Reviews.Title: “Great newest Butterfly in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: Kurnalsam
Reviews.Content: Had to vacate my former hotel since they were doubling the price on a Friday night and came across the Butterfly here. Good price and a brand new place in a great location with easy access to the streetcar and bus lines; lively area with good restaurants. Hotel was very modern and rooms were well laid out though smallish, which was okay as it was just myself. Free wifi and good access in the small lobby on all new Mac computers. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: xpla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. Just a few minutes walk from Times Square. Check in very efficient. Staff is well familiar with the area and gave good explanations and directions. I was upgraded to the 21st floor, great view of the town! The room was quite large, enough for 2 people, very clean. Room service efficient. Rate is good value for money. I will definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WinQiuchan
Reviews.Content: This time we are staying near by time square in Causeway bay.Great and nice hotel. Very clean and helpful assistant. The enter is very small.But we find the hotel anyway. This time we have 2 single bed instant double bed.Because Asian double bed is very small.(140cmX200cm) too small for us and our baby. Shopping: Few minutes by foot is time square.Great shopping center... and also there is sogo and the lee garden.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: timtam0
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, we had tried to book the new hotel Butterfly on Victoria but that did not open on time so we choose the Butterfly on Morrison. They re-organised the booking with no problems and when we arrived the reception was very good. The deluxe room was very good, The location is so convenient even if taxis do not always know where to go. If in doubt use South Pacific Hotel on Sharp Street West and walk a short distance

Reviews.Title: “good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: gotlight
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, wifi, quite close to the center but at the same time in a truly chinese district, which adds to its charm since you are genuinely in Hong Kong. To get to the center, it is only a 20mn tram ride, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Chewbaca S
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a cheap and relatively good location for a hotel stay with parents. Although the hotel room is small and cramp but it is clean and well-maintained. I must highlight that the view of the 22nd floor room was breathtaking and the staff were polite and provided assistance to us. As my parents were not able to check out at 12pm, Ms Stefani Tsai assisted us by extending the check out timing to 2pm which enable them to come back in time for the check out. I must say her service was wonderful. Another colleague of her, Ms Joyce Leung provided assistance with the luggage for my elderly parents. I would have to thank her for being a kind soul to assist them with the luggage. Again, I emphasize that the staff in this hotel provides good service and the rooms are well-maintained. However, the location of this hotel can be hard to locate. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: BiztravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: If you like horse racing (or shopping), this hotel is right in the action - near Happy Valley racecourse and Times Square Shopping Complex. Our deluxe room overlooked the racecourse and it looked amazing lit up at night, and was a close walk - check out the Wednesday night racing schedule; its a fun filled night on the lawn with music between races and lots of fun happening on course amongst locals and expats alike. The hotel is boutique - nice (small) rooms, nice amenities ad everything you need for comfort - only 4 rooms per floor so noise is minimal, which is great. Helpful staff and a nice atmosphere all round.

Reviews.Title: “My biggest regret”
Reviews.Author: Olivia K
Reviews.Content: I was in HK a few weeks ago and we stayed at Dorsett regency in Kennedy town and everything was awesome however the location was far from everything. Coming back from taipei .. We decided to stay at butterfly on morrison in HK thinking itd be great since we booked an executive room on the 28th floor. To my surprise... It wasnt great, it was horrible. The shower and bassin are always clogged even after i complained 3 times! The bathroom floor looks dirty. They try to ask their so called engineer to fix the drain problem but its useless and the front desk keeps on apologizing .... But nothing is done or improved. For the price i paid i expected much better. The only reason why i havent left yet is because of the location. Never again will i stay at this boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great rooms, will use again!”
Reviews.Author: TheLush101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June 2012. To get to the hotel I took the Airport Express to Hong Kong Station - I was meeting a friend who lives in Hong Kong, so we took a taxi to the hotel (or rather the road it was on, as the taxi driver hadn't heard of it) - this cost about HK$45 including HK$5 for my luggage (this was a Sunday evening so traffic wasn't an issue, might cost more at peak times). The entrance is pretty easy to find although it isn't big - take the lift to the 3rd floor for reception. Check-in was swift and the staff speak very good English. I was given an upgrade to a deluxe room, which was great - still don't quite understand how hotels dish out their upgrades, but it might be because I booked directly via the hotel's website; it was cheaper than every website comparison site I could find and means they don't pay commission. On check-in, they did give me the wrong room key at first - it was obvious though from the fact the room had someone else's stuff in and by the time I'd gone back reception, the staff were already coming to meet me with the correct key. I didn't find this a big deal as it was an honest mistake and I did notice later that the hotel is full of security cameras (in the hallways and lifts) so your belongings are secure. My room was on the 16th floor and was of ample size - other reviewers have complained about the size of the rooms but I can only comment on the one I had, which would be sufficient for two people, even with luggage. Sadly, I wasn't on the Happy Valley side (although you could still see the corner of the race-course as the photo shows) but being high up you still get a good view of the city and can't hear any of the traffic noise below. The room was exactly as it's described - there were tea/coffee making facilities, a fridge (built in to part of the wardrobe, along with a valuables safe), an iPod dock (worth noting though that it didn't charge my iPhone 4, so make sure you still bring your cable), plus an LCD TV, with several English channels, and a DVD player (didn't use the latter, it was by the bed though rather than under the TV). One reviewer had problems finding plug sockets but this wasn't an issue - there was one by the desk and one under the bedside cabinet. The bed was very comfy, probably because the hotel's relatively new. The air con worked very well and has a sleep mode, which cranks the noise down to help you at night while still keeping things cool. Do see what other reviewers have meant about the bathroom - e.g. there's just a clear glass panel enclosing the shower, then the walls between the bathroom and bedroom are glass - although there are now blinds to provide some sort of privacy - given that most of the hotel is double rooms, then this shouldn't be a problem for single travellers or couples. Was plenty of hot water and good water pressure - got 2 new toothbrushes and mini-tubes of toothpaste every day as well as 2 small bottles of water. The rooms were also cleaned to a very high standard and on the day I did see the housekeeper, she was apologetic for disturbing me (it was 10am or so mind!). The wifi was good, had a strong signal and speed was good. Location-wise, it's about a 10-15 minute walk to the MTR (Exit A at Times Square), although it's worth noting that you'll walk for another 10 minutes from Exit A to the actual trains. There are other exits for Causeway Bay station that are a further walk above ground, but get you nearer to the trains. There's a 7/11 (corner shop) just down from the hotel and one across the road too. Just down a bit further is Hennessy Road where you can get one of the trams (well worth the experience). Between the MTR and Hennessy Road is a local market, great for photos and to see some of the local food on offer. Overall, I'd definitely use this hotel again as the facilities are modern whilst available at a reasonable price. The location is also great, as it's slightly away from the bustle of Time Square, but a short walk to get to the MTR and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Excelhotel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite new, the room is quite big by hong kong standard. Bath room is excellent. My room viewing the race course, high rise building and mountain. The night view was awesome. It is located about 3 minute walks to times square shopping center and causeway MTR. Another 2min walks further down,SOGO departmental store is just across the road. Famous eatery shops are also located in this area example the famous Mak wanton mee, deserts and etc. At the back of the hotel, there is a market and stalls selling fruits and dried stuff like dried shrimp, dried abolone, scallop and many more Chinese medicinal products are reasonable price due to these stalls are patronized by local. If you want to do your own laundry, there is self service kiosk (with dryer) pay by octopus card is located at the back of the hotel. The hotel staffs are very helpful and will do whatever to ensure that your requests are met. We enjoy our 5 night stay and thanks for the good hospitality. i definitely will go back to this hotel in my return trip. From Danny and family, JB, pMalaysia

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: nicolelee77
Reviews.Content: Nice room.i stayed at a deluxe room.it was quite spacious for hongkong standard. Location is very near to times square.jz 5min walking distance.but it was a 15min walking distance to mtr.

Reviews.Title: “Fluttering around Hong Kong...”
Reviews.Author: carolannt
Reviews.Content: After 10 days at the Butterfly on Wellington, I wanted to change the scenery and moved to Causeway Bay. At first, I regretted it, the location on Morrison is not that great, then I saw my room...I booked a superior room, that's what I had on Wellington and it was so spacious. Obviously, the room at Morrison are tinier. I couldn't fit my three suitcases, I immediately went down to the reception to complain. And they upgraded me to a Deluxe room which was much better. I liked the modern decoration very much, there is even a chair similar to the one I have in my own bedroom at home. But still, I don't think I would come back to that hotel, the area is noisier, you can hear the traffic.The staff is polite and professional, but not as warm and friendly as they are on Wellington. The other day I was lost in Central, I went back to Butterfly hotel to ask for guidance and use the Wifi in the lobby. They've been so kind, they even wrote down the address I was going to in Chinese, to make it easier for me if I needed to ask a taxi or someone in the street. I've heard that Butterfly hotel will open a new location in Causeway Bay in July near by the metro, maybe worth to check it out...

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: cashewnutt
Reviews.Content: My SO and I stayed in Morrison Executive Room on the highest floor with paranomic view of Happy Vally Racecourse, 2 nights stay. Terrific and pleasant. Bed was super comfortable and the room is simply beautiful. Did not have much interaction with the staff as their reception is situated on Level 3 or 4. Hence, would not need to go pass the reception when we go out. Location wise, it's still quite a walk to Times Square, about 8 mins walk. Nearby, there are nice eateries, especially the one that sells takeaway sushi, yummy! Transportation can be tricky as the walk to the nearest MTR station need about 10 mins. There is a busstop just in front of the hotel, but not much choices. Even it may not be that convenient, would still recommend the hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Alfian
Reviews.Content: I am the Marketing Manager of DISINI Luxury Spa Villas Bali and traveled to Hong Kong and stayed for 3 nights at Butterfly On Morrison... very short vacation. what i found at the moment was unexpected hotel, when i enter the room yes it small, but it really clean.but i was taken the package include wi fii in the room which so much help for me. the most i satisfied about this hotel is the helpful staff, he (maybe Steven the name) was not only show me direction to go, but give some advice where to go. so my first experience for Hong kong so Amazing due i am traveling with my love... just wanna say thanks to Steven for show me how to get to Macau....

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - get the suite on the 28th floor!”
Reviews.Author: Bert-Jan E
Reviews.Content: After some research I decided to book this hotel for my business trip. It's conveniently located near to the Wan Chai area, and a short taxi drive from the Central area if you arrive by airport express. The hotel has a very friendly check in - and when I checked in late, I got offered a complimentary upgrade to the suite on the 28th floor. Normally extra costs would be 55SGD. The room is small - but has *stunning* views on the racecourse. Internet and TV works perfectly. It has ipod docks and all lights can be regulated from your bed. The showers are hot and comfy. Two areas for improvement: More plugs for charging stations needed. And I couldn't empty the washing basin(?!) after using. Probably my fault. Did't use the breakfast - also not sure if there was a breakfast area. Definitely commendable for business or leasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonbabyxox
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Butterfly Hotel for 3 nights recently and loved it so much. Beds, pillows, furnishing and bathroom - all good.

Reviews.Title: “Suite view”
Reviews.Author: LandHBrisbane
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in the suite, room 2802 .Room size was impressive,and furnishings well done.The shower was one of the best I have had in a hotel room,and the pillows amazing.Nespresso coffee machine is a nice touch too.View of the mountains and racetrack was great. Easy walk to Times Square station,or the trams.There is a tram line out the front but it is one way coming from Happy Valley. Did not eat at the restaurant,but plenty of places to eat close by,and a upmarket supermarket in basement level of Times Square called Citisuper that sells all kinds of ready to eat meals. Closest Seven Eleven ,turn right from the front exit and it is a short distance down towards the main tram line.Wanchai Star ferry terminal is close walk as well. One thing that bothered me was there was only ONE spare power socket in the whole suite.It is on the floor near the front door,no power point in the well set out bathroom.I disconnected the phone to charge my laptop. WI-Fi was fast and free. Would stay again as it is close to everything. On arrival at Hong kong airport we got the shuttle bus to the hotel @ HK$300 for two.Our return to the airport we took a taxi from outside the front of the South Pacific hotel,was half the time of the bus and not that more expensive. The taxi will charge you HK$5.00 per pice of baggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great place + location in HK”
Reviews.Author: camski
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are looking for a low-key, more boutique feel rather than a large run hotel. The front desk is great with answering any questions and providing any extras you may need (ironing board, giving directions etc..) and the hotel is will kept. It has very modern-like vibe to it, with simple yet clean designs/rooms. The location is walking distance from the the racehorse stadium which is great on Wednesday nights. It is 5 minutes from the MTR in times square and there are tons of restaurants+shops all around. It is very easy to get around and is a bustling area (Causeway Bay) in HK. Def recommend for a good hotel with great value in HK!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE AND LOCATION FOR SAVVY TRAVELERS”
Reviews.Author: mikemcd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the first time recently. I travel to HK frequently and have a list of 2-3 hotels I regularly use. Now Butterfly will be added to that list. Butterfly is exactly as other TA reviews have described. It's in a new/modern, and in a superb location in Wanchai, very close to Causeway Bay Times Square and Sogo. Other points: rooms are well designed but not large, good value for your money, no breakfast in the hotel but plenty of places nearby, fast/free internet, and comfortable beds. Basically Butterfly has all that a value minded, savvy traveler needs, and nothing extra. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “not bad value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: david h
Reviews.Content: Nice location for Times Square and Causeway Bay areas. Decent rooms for the money and free wifi. Stayed there 4 times now and will again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: johanna_dxb
Reviews.Content: Had a nice lux room on the 17th floor; quiet with ok views. Plenty of hot water and no issues with the room temperature. Wifi was fast and complimentary. Didn’t eat in the restaurant; there are so many fab restaurants in Hong Kong so no need for a hotel restaurant and also for a breakfast there’s a Starbucks a few minutes away. A tram is also a few minutes away; easy to get taxis in the from of the hotel next door. Metro is bit further away (or at least the underground walking distance). Would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Good value for Price”
Reviews.Author: tyhwam
Reviews.Content: Nice design of the rooms, good value for price, nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Good option in HK at a convenient price”
Reviews.Author: MisterGan
Reviews.Content: Butterfly Hotels are one of my first choice when I'm travelling in budget accomodations in Hong Kong. I paid less than 1000 HKD for 1 night. At Morrison Hotel, rooms are tiny but comfortable and well designed. The bathroom was clean, and the bed ok. Free wi-fi connection. The service is quite decent and hospitality of the staff is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Quite impressive for the price”
Reviews.Author: BtheBear
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms in HK are small and expensive. BoM's rooms are small but the price was really not too bad for a well situated, clean hotel with good service. And if you are fortunate enough to get a room on a high floor looking south, as we were, the floor to ceiling windows certainly make the room feel bigger. Stayed for 8 nights and really enjoyed it. I can't say I agree with previous reviews that said there were no places for breakfast nearby. Had no problems finding a range of eateries - western and chinese - within short walking distance for all meals. In fact I thought the location was excellent. Transportation is easy. The tram is right there and it is only a short walk to the subway. Used the laundry and my clothes were returned in super quick time. Free wifi for all my devices. Clean, modern. As other have said, what eles do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Scuzzer
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best hotels, in terms of location (Morrison), room size and privacy. All other hotels I stayed in have tiny rooms. This one is nice, free wifi, clean, no hassles. My favourite when I go there on business. Walking distance to the bar area of Lan Kwai Fong.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern and chic hotel 2 minutes from the subway. What else do you want ?”
Reviews.Author: croz17
Reviews.Content: 2 minutes to causeway bay subway. Fantastic room layout with good bed, safe, large fridge and storage space for clothes. Not small and cramped like other HK hotels. Courteous staff and easy check in. Very clean. Only 4 rooms per floor with end rooms elliptical shaped with glass on two sides. One side looked straight into a ratty old apartment but you are not likely to sit at the window all day! Quiet enough and certainly dark enough at night making for good sleeps. Did not eat in the restaurant so I can't comment. Everything you need is within walking distance. great free wifi. Strongly recommend and will stay here Again. Booked for $110 CAN per night through agoda.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nearest hotel to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Katzip
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in March with my family. Decor modern and tasteful. Their standard room is quite small but this is normal by HK standard. We upgraded one room to a deluxe which is much roomier and comfortable. Management must have read earlier Trip Advisers reviews cause they have installed venetian blinds in the bathrooms but even so, I cannot share this room with anyone but my husband! Beds are comfortable and room newly furnished and very clean. There are ample storage spaces and even space for one large luggage. I like that is is very near Times Square and MTR. Less than 200m away, there is a interesting daytime street market which converts into seafood restaurants at night. We didn't eat there but seafood looks fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and cosy rooms”
Reviews.Author: DreamzSG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10mins walk from the MTR station where Times Square is also located. There are plenty of shops to explore in Times Square as well as around Times Square. Sogo is about 10mins walk away. Tram station is also about 10mins walk away and you can take a scenic ride to explore Hong Kong Island. We are very grateful to their friendly and responsible hotel staff :D. Housekeeping alerted the Front Desk that our room door was opened and check the CCTV to ensure that no one has entered our room. They called us immediately to alert us and deactivated the cardkey. The rooms are cosy and clean :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: NilakshiS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room for five days. Though the room is not as large as it looks in the official pictures, it is very well laid out with a dedicated space for everything. For example, the cupboard space is enough for two people’s clothes for about 7 days and suitcases can also be tucked into the cupboard. Overall, it is a clean and organized hotel. We needed an early check-in and late check-out and the hotel was kind enough to accommodate both the requirements. Location is good since the MTR at Times Square is only a short walk. And the tram runs on this road. The Wan Chai Wet Market, located just behind the hotel, is the place for fresh seafood and a rather interesting place to walk thru.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gholms
Reviews.Content: the hotel is clean, modern and reasonably well positioned in hong kong. Check-in was good, excellent free wifi, very few english channels on the TV. The only downside of this hotel is the size of the rooms, although I think this is a common problem in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jan A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and was pleased with the service and location of the hotel. It was a quick was to Causeway Bay, Times Square and MTR. Room service was very good. Internet access was extremely fast for a hotel. The only issue was that the room temperature cannot be regulated in the room so that the rooms becomes very cold in the night. The regulator on the wall just doesn't work. And the room becomes cold as anywhere indoor in Hong Kong. Turning off the air conditioning is not an option because it becomes too warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: CindyZX
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was convenient, close to MRT, SOGO and Time Square, with heaps of restaurants around. Although the room was small as expected in HK, it was very well-designed. I stayed at the 18th floor, but there was no much view out there, all blocked by the buildings around. The only thing was that I booked for a superior room and I arrived at around 2pm, but I was told that the room was still not available. The hotel staff suggested me taking an upgrade to the deluxe room (cost me HK$220 per night) otherwise I would have to wait for another 40mins to an hour! I still had plans with friends on that day, so couldn't wait and paid for the upgrade. Considering the checkout time being 12pm as most other hotels in Asia, I simply cannot figure out why the room wasn't ready at 2pm! Was this a way to trick me to get an upgrade? I took the Airport Express (HK$100 one-way) to the Hong Kong Station and realised that there was no shuttle bus to the hotel, therefore had to call a taxi (cost me $38). Instead, you can take MTR to Causeway Bay and walk to the hotel (about 10 to 15 mins) - probably not the best way for travelers with luggages tho!

Reviews.Title: “Five stars, Morrison”
Reviews.Author: sky w
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Morrison Hotel. Hotel is in a good location but really impressed us is the service (Really Five stars). The staff (EDWIN) was without exception very attentive and helping us during our stay. We will definately be back and would recommed it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: angel h
Reviews.Content: I have been stayed in Causeway Bay area for few times, and this is my first time to stay in Morrison, which really impressed me. The hotel is just about five minutes walk from Time Square, that is one of the most popular shopping mall in Hong Kong. When I stepped into the G/F lobby, 2 bellmen assited my luggage immediately. I was guided to the 3/F check in counter. The girls at the counter gave me a warm welcome with big smile. The room is clean and tidy, relatively bigger than the other hotels in Causeway Bay. Morrison will be my next choice in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stsy”
Reviews.Author: cwchen
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to HK but first time stay in Butterfly Hotel which made my trip perfect. The service was excellence compare with the five stars, room is morden and clean, even no restaurant in the hotel, can just spend 10 minutes walk to Time Square for whatever want to eat and shop, will stay again for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Boutique Hotel And Good Value in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SF-Coast-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a few nights. The Butterfly is a highrise hotel located in Causeway Bay just a 7 minute walk to Times Square, Happy Valley Racecourse, and the busy shopping areas around Causeway Bay and Wan Chai. The Causeway Bay MTR Station is about a 12 minute walk (from hotel to the train platform). A couple of the tram lines pass directly in front of the hotel and numerous bus lines also stop directly in front of the hotel. The reception lobby is on the third floor of the hotel. Reception staff were welcoming, friendly, and helpful. I reserved a deluxe room and was assigned a room on the 23rd floor with views of Wan Chai and the Happy Valley Racecourse. The room was small but on par with the size of rooms at other HK hotels I've stayed at for around the same room rate. The dark wood furnishings in the room gave a feeling of elegance. The room was oval shaped with large floor to ceiling windows on both sides of the room. It gave me the feeling of being in a fish tank. The building next door was literally less than five feet away (see photo). The exterior of the large windows had a reflective coating so presumably (I hope) people from the next door building could not see inside the room. Plus, there were heavy curtains that could be closed to keep out light and ensure privacy. The room was furnished with a flat screen TV and free broadband Internet access (in the event you bring a laptop) and a small sofa. There was a safe in the closet. The closet provided adequate storage space. Another thoughtful amenity was a plug adaptor which could accomodate plug types from various countries. The bathroom was enclosed by glass walls. The walls facing the bedroom had window shades that could be closed. There were partially opaque glass doors on each side of the bathroom but not opaque enough to provide any measure of privacy for someone using the bathroom. For single travellers this isn't an issue but when traveling with another person the privacy issue might be an "issue"! My room only had a shower but it was rather spacious. The stand where the small sink sat upon offered no counter space but the shelves in front of the sink and behind the toilet offered adequate storage space. A variety of bath amenities was provided. The mattress on the bed was not as firm as many mattresses I have slept on in hotels in other Asian countries and was quite comfortable. The linens were clean and crisp. Overall, the room was quite clean. The only exception was the tile in the shower which needed some maintenance as mildew was becoming prevelant. Guests could use for free the two computers (with Internet access) located on the 3rd floor next to reception. I did not use the restaurant at the hotel (first floor) as there were so many other dining and bar options in the immediate area of the hotel. Overall, this is a very nice hotel in a good location with reasonably priced rooms. I plan to stay again at this hotel on future visits to HK. GETTING THERE The easiest option is by hotel shuttle bus. Go to counter B1 just outside of Customs / Immigration to arrange for transportation. The cost is HK$150 (about US$19). The bus will drop you off within about a 1 minute walk to the hotel. Travel time, depending on traffic and the number of other people on the bus who are dropped off before you, is anywhere from 45-90 minutes. Another option is the Airport Express Train which costs HK$110 (about US$14). Take the train to HK Station (about 25 minutes), then a taxi to the hotel (about HK$40-50 depending on traffic). You could take the subway (Blue - Island Line) to the Causeway Bay Station but it is a rather long walk, with luggage, from the platform to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for my stay in hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Chenjq
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in hong kong,I choose this hotel because of good location. Service was great,the room was clean and new renovated,everything are perfect

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in HK”
Reviews.Author: OfficiallyForeign
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hong Kong 6 times now and have stayed at the Butterfly on Morrison twice. I think it offers the best value for the money by far. I stayed at places that charge US $50-100 more and do not offer any additional luxuries than the Butterfly on Morrison does. Rooms are small, like most in Hong Kong, but beds are comfortable, hotel is updated and location is good... about a 10 minute walk to the MTR. The Butterfly on Wellington is much closer to the MTR and I think I will stay there next time. Would definitely recommend for a good value in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms, no heating system”
Reviews.Author: Diegzynko
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in the Butterfly Hotel. I paid for an upgrade to a Superior Room, but it was almost the same as the room I booked, so I paid a little more for an upgrade to a Suite. The suite is nice, really good view. The rooms still are small (but ok, is Hong Kong, for these prices you can't get bigger rooms in a good location) but the only problem was the heating system. Even when I called and someone came to touch the thermostat (was set in 32 degrees...) and they told me to wait for a few hours, by the time I return to my room it was in 16 degrees... It was colder in my room than outside! When complaint to the reception, the solution they provide was to bring a heater and plug it in the room. By the way, there are really few plugs available, so we had to disconnect the audio system and other things in order to plug the 2 heaters they brought. Another thing, in this boutique hotel there's no breakfast included, they don't have room service or anything. This is not a complaint since they never say they have all this, but I think is worth to mention for others to be aware of this. Good thing: Time Square is 5 minutes away walking, and there you can do shopping, have a coffee (or the breakfast you don't have in the hotel...) or take the subway to somewhere else. For the price, I could say is OK in HK Island.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but there are better hotels nearby!”
Reviews.Author: running_daily
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the hotel - great location about 5mins from Times Square so great for shopping. Good local restaurants nearby but the worse thing about the hotel was noise levels. Our first room was 503 and you can hear the traffic (on a main road) as if you were standing outside...we changed to room 2201 which was much better. So if you do plan to stay I would request one of the rooms high up!

Reviews.Title: “A great niche in a saturated city!”
Reviews.Author: Cain9ine
Reviews.Content: We were initially upgraded from a twin room on the first night to a double on the second when reception realised we were a couple. Having stayed in both, I would recommend each depending on how you're travelling and who with. As a usual backpacker it was nice to have a unique hotel at an affordable price, close to everything. I loved the availability of the Apple computers in the reception area, and the futuristic elevators... however there are only two for the entire building and they sometimes take a while to get to your floor. There were a few ants and a leak in the bathroom sink, but other than that, I was very satisfied with staying here.

Reviews.Title: “hotel's most valuable resource is its staff”
Reviews.Author: Piggy1009
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in all 3 hotels of the group in HK, I found Butterfly on Morrison not just with nice & open view overseeing the jockey club and very convenient location, also have the best customer service out of the 3 hotels. Although the room wasn't spacious, woke up with the nice view was just energizing. The only thing to criticize is the entrance wasn't easy to find...... Warm welcome really meant a lot, especailly after a long day travel. Edwin was extremely helpful and friendly, he made me feel very welcomed with his big smile and outstanding hospitality. Congratulation to the management of Butterfly for having professional staff like Edwin. I will definitely stay at Butterfly on Morrisson when I am back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff.”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived around mid-night after a very bumpy flight from Sydney. At Reception, Natalie Yuen made us feel so welcomed that we forgot our exhaustion and how tiny is the room. On the ninth day of our 14-day stay we were recomanded by local friends to move to a similar hotel but with lower room rates. However, since we were so impressed by staff like Patricia Chang and Keith Leung, we decided not to move from Butterfly.On M. We have stayed at many hotels around the world during our years of travelling, but the staff of this hotel is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Benfamily11
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 11 staying at Butterfly on Morrison for two nights (great deals). The hotel is conveniently located near MTR, tram, stores, fresh market and many choices of restaurants. The hotel is nice and clean with about 20 sqm which is typical of Hong Kong and Japan. We are seniors so we don't know if there are night clubs around. Hong Kong is shopping and food paradise. We spent some time touring around the Victoria Peak (too bad it was cloudy that day) and the gigantic Big Bhuda. Before arrival, we were debating of how to get from airport to hotel. We ended up with 3 taxis from airport to hotel (about $HK 350 each) but with shuttle bus ($HK850) arranged thru hotel to airport. There are so many options to choose from. Please do some research about transportation in term of cost, convenience and your walking ability. Good luck and enjoy your visit Ben and Family

Reviews.Title: “My stay at morrison”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Very clean and ideally located for shopping and food. Near to the MTR station no problem to the airport by MTR right next to times square. The most important one is the excellent and prompt service. ESP.front desk staff Ms. Patricia and Ms Joey. Would highly recommend for travelers including family. No qualms about room size, excellent shower and linens.

Reviews.Title: “some attention needed to an otherwise good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sculthorpe-Pike
Reviews.Content: We have been to all three Butterfly Hotels in HK and this one was our first. We returned there just a few days ago during Chinese New Year - always a bad time to travel. The staff are exceptional. We arrived from Manila and HK seemed really cold. As with most HK hotels, apparently, heating is not provided in winter and so when we asked how to turn on the heating we were met with a surprised response. However, two thick blankets arrived within minutes and the following night an electric radiator had been procured for our use. My advice to the management - 1. check all your pillows and spend some money on replacements - 2. please put some hooks in the bathrooms, away from the shower spray - 3. a kettle in the rooms would be a welcome addition especially as you do not provide room service. Other than these minor complaints the hotel is good value and well located for the MTR and Times Square shopping/cinemas etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Aidin489
Reviews.Content: At first I shoul say that it is a boutique hotel, so all expectations shall be in compliance to this important fact. The hotel is located near welknown times square (5 minutes walk) there is MTR station in times square so it can be said that your distance to every every important place in HK and Kowloon is 5 minutes walk plus a train that should be catches. Room was clean with good view, decorated modernly, clean and free Internet was included.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful butterfly”
Reviews.Author: kitkat20121011
Reviews.Content: very good service! big thanks to Edwin and Joyce!!! they are very friendly. i love to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: finendandy21
Reviews.Content: The hotel had everything that I look for in a hotel - good location (5 min walk to Times Square / Causeway Bay MTR station), free wifi (very fast), a comfortable bed and a clean room. The room I had was tiny and just right for 1 person (the bed was walled in on 3 sides). I would imagine it being really tight for 2 people with suitcases. But for the price in Hong Kong, no complaints at all about the space. The only complaint I have about the hotel are the pipes. When someone else uses their toilet / shower / sink, it sounds as though it's right in your room. If you're a light sleeper, the sound of water throughout the whole night can be an issue (if you're on a lower floor). Overall, a great little hotel I'd stay in again if I were traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: theovanightsensation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in January. The location was really convenient and the room was well designed (iPod dock, wi fi, etc). Really good value for money. But, the room was a little dusty in places and the water in the bathroom had a funny smell to it. I'd recommend it because a lot of similar hotels are around 40% more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: zubzub h
Reviews.Content: near to masjid ammar so easy access to halal food... near bowrington road market and causeway bay MTR.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at butterfly on Morrison”
Reviews.Author: Jenny C
Reviews.Content: I like to stay here because it's very clean, and good location ( bit still need time 15 min to walk to times square)...

Reviews.Title: “No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: GeraldJBangkok
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Butterfly on Morrison in late November and was very satisfied with the room and service. The hotel is a few short blocks from Hennessy Rd. and about a 10 minute walk to the MTR Station at Times Square. Like most hotel rooms in Hong Kong in this price range, the rooms can be quite small. I was upgraded to a Deluxe Room that was more than adequate in size and quite well ouffitted with the essential amenities. Free internet that worked well, a spotlessly clean room, a spacious glass enclosed bathroom, an efficient desk, very good lighting and a pleasant view of the city and the Happy Valley Racetrack made for an enjoyable stay. The staff was friendly and efficient. After checking out on the last day, one of girls from the hotel walked me to the corner to assist in getting me a cab, which I apppreciated very much. There is no designated spot in front of the hotel for taxis, but it's only about 40-50 meters down the street where it's easy to get a taxi on a nearby street corner. My taxi driver didn't have any problems dropping me off right in front of the hotel when I first arrived though. The Causeway Bay location is convenient to shopping, the racetrack, hundreds of restaurants and not too far from the MTR where you can get just about anywhere in Hong Kong. I enjoyed my stay at the Butterfly on Morrison, the larger Deluxe Room probably had something to do with that. I would definitely consider staying there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly”
Reviews.Author: Paulina K
Reviews.Content: I spent in Butterfly hotel 2 wonderful days. Hotel is located in nice area, windows views are amazing:) and service is warm, nice, and quick. I recommend this place to everyone. Its worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not let me cancel direct on phone 6 days prior to arrival!!!”
Reviews.Author: VooDooTravelPro
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Booking.com for 15-16 Dec 2011. Then when my business schedule changed I called the hotel to cancel on 8th Dec. However because I called hotel on 8th dec in San Francisco it was already the 9th of Dec in Hong Kong. Hotel refused to cancel!!! They asked me to contact Booking.com - who promptly made me pay for the room even though I gave 6 days notice. Unbelievable! Horrible attitude by hotel and awful approach to cancellations by Booking.com. I guess I go back to Travelocity and Hotels.com and I will never use Butterfly on Morrison again.

Reviews.Title: “Tight squeeze in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: YVRTravelGirl_10
Reviews.Content: The Butterfly on Morrison is a small boutique hotel located in the Causeway Bay vicinity. The hotel is a short walk away from the Times Square shopping centre and the Causeway Bay MTR station. Getting to the hotel is a bit inconvenient as there is no stopping in front of the hotel. Your taxi (if you take one) is going to pull into a short street further down the road from the Butterfly for you to unload. The hotel itself has the reception on one of the upper floors – not on the main floor as you enter. This reception area has a sick sweet overpowering smell of air fresher. Not sure if it has to be that intense. The room that I had was very small if not microscopic. It is a bit of an awkward layout but an efficient use of space given that it is a premium in Hong Kong. The bed is at one side with a long desk area, closet and the cutest mini lime green fridge that I have seen. They do have a kettle as well which is great for boiling a pot of tea if need be. The bathroom is well lit and very modern. I found the room to be clean and comfortable. The location is great as you can pop out for a short bit down the street to find a coffee shop or place to eat. There is also a local food market which is fascinating to see. Small bakeries are also nearby if you just want to pick up a Chinese bun for a snack or breakfast. The internet connection was fast and efficient. You just had to log in everytime with their username and passcode which can be bothersome. I found the concierge to be helpful and provided directions and instruction for places I needed to get to for my meetings. Certainly not a steal for the price but a good choice for a relatively convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Small and difficult to access”
Reviews.Author: Anwil51
Reviews.Content: Butterfly on Morrison sounds great - but in reality despite being quite new - the combination of small rooms (not uncommon in Hong Kong) and difficulty getting to and from made it a poor choice. The location has no access directly in front so our arrival by taxi was to a nearby street corner then walking along with bags to the entrance. The room was clean and tidy, but cramped, and we found the layout hard to accommodate two people. We also had difficulty getting taxis each day to get to our conference and with no concierge on the ground floor (reception is 3rd floor) we had no help. Staff were helpful and but not really able to solve the main issues.

Reviews.Title: “Better Boutique Hotel Options than this!”
Reviews.Author: MIWSing
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor but it was not a good experience and we'd never stay here again. I have just seen another review for this hotel posted on 30th October called “Good and Bad points to this Hotel” and I would say ditto to the comments in there. We also stayed in an '03' room which I gather is the worst configuration in this hotel and exacerbates the issues with the room. In addition to the comments in that review, I would also add a little more: Good points: - Didn't particularly like the location - it's a long walk to the Convention Centre (which was where we needed to be every day). There are very few decent restaurants around and no decent coffee shop or place to have breakfast that's within comfortable walking distance - Free wi fi is provided but it's a pain in the neck in that you don't instantly connect and continually need to enter your room number and a password all the time. But the fact that had free wi fi was a key reason for booking this hotel as I hate hotels that don't have it! Bad - Even though we're happy to eat 'local' for breakfast, the options near the hotel aren't great - It is noisy - noisy in terms of street noise and noisy in the room. I was awake a good part of the night - in fact as explained in the previous review mentioned, I also thought someone was in my room when the person in the room above or next to me used their bathroom for any purpose! -the room is stupidly small - one side of the bed is against a window and the other side has about a half metre between the bed and wall. There is only a metre or so of free space between the end of the bed and the tiny desk. The room was absolutely NOT suitable for two people. - the room was dirty. There were many areas that were dirty - esp in the bathroom. And the tiles in the entrance area (about a metre square) were so filthy that when we look at our feet after coming out of the shower they were black!! Ugggghhh! - Apart from one uncomfortable chair at the tiny desk in the room there was no place to sit so you can't really relax in the room. - You also can't be dropped off outside the hotel as it's a no stopping area so you need to get into and out of cabs a block down the road. This makes it inconvenient when you have luggage, or if it's raining. I think perhaps some of the other room configurations may have been bigger but that doesn't get away from many of the other issues I encountered. I stayed at the Bauhinia Hotel in Central a week earlier for a similar price and that was just a different experience altogether. So I think you can do a lot better than the Butterfly on Morrison if you're looking for a good value boutique hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “good location for shoppers !”
Reviews.Author: shea1980
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel for 2 nights from 5 - 7th nov. the room was clean and no noise level as commented by others, probably because i'm staying at 22nd flr. bascially, i have a good night sleep and was well rested during the 2 nights after touring hong kong. the free wifi is a plus ! would be perfect if the hotel can throw in free breakfast. would appreciate if i can have fresh brew coffee in the morning without having the need to get it outside from cafes. the hotel has many great places for shopping and it is only 10 min walk to causeway bay shopping district. perfect for people who want to shop around the hotel but do not want to travel far. lots of nice restaurants nearby too. had dimsum at feng cheng restaurant, 2 streets away from hotel. nice food and reasonable price. the nearby wet market is perfect for people who want to experience what the local life is like.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Sebmtb
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights while on a trip in Hong Kong, location is good as the Times Squares shopping center and subway are just around the corner. Area is lively and you get a closer look at how the people of Hong Kong really live. Room was small but clean and well appointed, staff was friendly and pretty much everyone spoke decent english.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad points to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pigsdofly
Reviews.Content: Ok, firstly, i am writing this review from room 803 in the Butterfly on Morrison, Hong Kong. So, firstly the good things; 1) The staff are excellent. Really top notch, helpful and friendly. 2) The hotel is well located and a 5 min walk through a cool market to Causeway Bay MTR. 3) It's modern, clean and everything works. Nice furnishings 4) Free wi fi internet throughout the hotel for the duration of your stay. Brilliant. Why 5* hotels make people pay for Wi Fi is beyond me and pretty appalling actually. Bad 1) No restaurant. Not the biggest problem but when i'm in Asia, i do want to have a western breakfast in the morning, especially when in Asia for business. Ending up going to the flying pan most mornings. 2) It's noisy. You are in the city so to be expected, but the noise of traffic on the 8th floor is pretty bad. The higher up you are the better the noise problem will be. 3) My room was located opposite the lift and it bings a couple of times every time it arrives on the floor, which was annoying. Hotel is quite narrow so most rooms might have this problem. 4) The biggest problem was that every time the room next to mine turned on a tap, flushed the loo or had a shower, it felt like they were in my bathroom. It was very loud. 5) No bar or lobby area. After a long day of meetings or at trade show i like to come back to my hotel and sit in a comfy lounge chair, have a beer and review the days work. Can't do that in this hotel. They do have a couple of computers near reception you can use but you sit on stools to use it. Summary Well, it's a nice, modern and clean hotel with fantastic staff. But i wouldn't stay here again. I want to have breakfast in the morning, i want a lobby area with a bar when i get back after a days work and i don't want the noise issues i had.

Reviews.Title: “Noise pollution is awful”
Reviews.Author: Natabella
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine how this hotel can claim to be 5 stars! I realise that this is a centre of busy city and room could be small but not THAT small! When on your bed your head is touching bathroom wall while your legs are almost sticking from the window. OK, I exaggerate a bit but you can touch the window by your legs as there is practically no space between the bed and window, And the widow is facing busy multi-level cross road intersection (plus trams!). I was ones in Nippon hotel by railway station in Kyoto facing the square with hundreds of busses taking passengers to and from the station. ANd - it was so quiet, you can hear a fly flies. The secret - double glazing and pricise setting. Thta is how it should be in noisy places. I had to stay at Butterfly for 2 nights. I hardly slept on first night and seriously considered to move out for my second night even with loss of money. I did not as I did not have enough enrgy after sleepless night and somehow I survived my second night. There is no breakfast available in there, and if you need to wait for consierge there is no seats. Just standing. Girls at reception were nice but it did not save the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Small but individual and convenient”
Reviews.Author: KYNicolson
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at the Excelsior Causeway Bay for a conference, but I missed the booking window, and from talking to my colleagues I was lucky! Booking a month ahead I got a decent rate of an average of HK$1,350 per night including taxes. Given that I was travelling alone and that the conference schedule was quite full, a convenient bed was my top priority, which is what the Butterfly offers. I had the smallest ("Superior") room on the 10th floor; I could see the hills at the back of Hong Kong, framed by some pretty tatty flats. The room consists of a bed, a counter desk with all the required connections, a cupboard, free-use mini-fridge, and a rather tiny toilet and shower booth. There are free slippers in the room, but as the toilet and entrance are both tiled, I did worry about dirty footprints. The stand-alone basin was tiny, but I suppose it keeps the cleaners employed... I could have done with a little more shelf space for even my modest needs - the mirror looked as if it might open up to reveal a triangular cupboard, but I couldn't find out how! There was also no hairdryer in the room. Location was great, 2 7-11s close for forgotten essentials, and Time's Square and other shopping areas 10 minutes walk away. Vegetarians, though, will need to keep eyes straight ahead and hold their breath while walking through the surrounding markets! As others have said, street noise is a problem past about 7am. I did find the staff friendly, although I had no direct contact outside check-in and check-out. I couldn't work out the air-conditioning in detail, but I usually managed to get it to run cool when needed!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for HKG, broken toe, nice view, location”
Reviews.Author: SalsabyJake
Reviews.Content: For HKG, the space in the room was average, meaning small, but I was on 21st floor with amazing views. The wireless worked well and the shower was excellent. I grew to like the location a lot too since it is only a block away from a food market area with many vendors selling fruit, fish (live), meats, etc, and Time Square/Causeway Bay MTR entrance also a short walk. Hennessy trolly/bus too. Of course my trip was literally ruined when I hit my toe on the leg of the bed and broke a toe! My main activity is dance and this was worst injury ever. The carpet is dark, and the legs of the furniture are chrome - reflecting the dark carpet and disappearing. Light level low too unless you put on the bright florescent lights. A friend stopped by and stubbed her toes on the chair leg in minutes. (Tight corners in room also contribute to this). Staff is only passable. I got the "blank stare" when I told them about my toe and simple things like borrowing an umbrella seemed complicated. Worse was that they double charged laundry to the card I had on file with them and then another card I used to settle my bill upon checkout! They don't answer the phone and the web site has NO contact form or info. Thumbs way down to that...

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: anskianna
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very very nice. The rooms are new, extremely nicely furnished, modern and everything is nice and clean. The rooms are small but so are most the hotel rooms in Hong Kong, at least the ones I have seen so I did not thinks thats a problem. The building looks more like an office building so at first we were having trouble believing this is actually the hotel we were looking for. Staff at reception polite and efficient. Good location - close to shopiing areas and metro,. We simply loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “'Very good' for Hong Kong, 'Terrible' for normal places. Result: 'Average'.”
Reviews.Author: GiloManila
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night stay at this hotel. What can one say? The rooms are small, with small beds and not exactly clean, the drainage of the shower was clogged, the bathroom at the reception area was plain filthy, staff were reasonably helpful but certainly not cordial. For this you have to pay the equivalent of USD 260 per night (no breakfast). This would certainly earn this place a 'Terrible' score in other locations, but considering this is Hong Kong (where hotels are notoriously filthy and overpriced, with puny rooms and rude staff) I guess 'Average' is a fair score. On the positive side, the location is very good, rooms are nicely decorated and they even have a view (which again is quite unusual in Hong Kong). Not really a place to recommend wholeheartedly, but is there any hotel which can be really recommended in Hong Kong? I haven't found any yet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny L
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. This is a boutique hotel that charge as high as Eaton Hotel (4 stars) in Jordon or Prudential Hotel at Nathan, $700 plus! It's terribly small which you can hardlly walk by having your lugguages on the floor. The distance to Causeway Bay station is also not near and you have to pass by their local wet market! Besides that, when you arrive, you have to alight at the backlane of the hotel and not the front entrance! Unglam! When you need to take cab to airport, you have to basically pull your lugguages yourself to the corner of the street and take a cab! Unglam and inconvenient! Imagined my lugguage was 30KG!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money!!”
Reviews.Author: Leongz
Reviews.Content: Just came back from HK. Stayed 2 nites at Butterfly on Morrison. In our opinion, this is budget hotel charging a 4 star price! The room is soooo small that u can't put 2 luggages nicely, there's practically no space to sit besides sitting on the bed! Location was so so only.... The room made us feel so claustrophobic and we paid more than S$700++ for 2 nites. REGRET! Definitely can stay in better quality hotel with this price. Booked this hotel after reading all the good reviews but me and my friends were greatly disappointed! Will NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Definitely won't come back...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surpirsed Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jay_Teo
Reviews.Content: I am in business trip again and this time I am heading to the trade fair in Hong Kong. High room rate everywhere in business season. I just pick this bontique hotel which is near to the fair venue. Late flight made me check in at night time but the reception was having a long queue. I am very tired and upset. Fortunately the reception lady (Jackie) check me in with a cheerful smile and she talked to me like a friend during the check in process. The lady next to her is busy but still wearing smile on her face. The atmosphere is warm. I request one big bed room and Jackie fulfilled my request. She passed me a Hong Kong Map and showed me the way to the convention centre ( however I will only travel by taxi L0L). Service is very attentive! The room itself is exactly like the pictures on the website. Good to have free internet access for a business traveller like me! Room is clean and tidy. Safe box can fit my notebook, not bad! Not much traffic was noticable even I am in low floor. Lobby bell boy (Andy) in the morning is helpful and he greet me with cheerful smile also. Every staff in the hotel were smiling! Will be back next time but hopefully for leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Butterfly on Morrison”
Reviews.Author: Photographer67
Reviews.Content: We just took a weekend trip to Hong Kong and stayed at the Butterfly on Morrison. The hotel has a great location, just a short walk to the metro station at Times Square. The room was clean, the decor is stylish, and the staff was professional and accommodating. Check in and check out went as smooth as could be. They even helped arrange a cake for my husband's birthday. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Rileypup
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. The Rooms are decorated to a high spec and they're really clean. The location is also fantastic - just 5 mins walk from Causeway Bay underground and Times Square shopping centre. The only drawback was having to pay a large cash deposit upon arrival although we'd paid for our room. We got it back when we checked out. There was no mention of a deposit when we booked our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend your vacation”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: It was a family visit. We were really curious about the cultural stuff. We spent almost two weeks there. excellent value and service. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANDY B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had our annual holiday in the Butterfly On Morrison Hotel. And one of the things you notice straight away is the staffs (Andy, Edwin & Joey) pleasant greeting you get whether they opening a door/calling the lift/or getting a taxi for you,they are always very courteous whatever the task.It is very clean and a well managed hotel.My boyfriend and I believe this is one of the best hotels.

Reviews.Title: “very central, chic (think W), clean, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: kaynen430
Reviews.Content: great location, great rate, very helpful staff, very clean and chic

Reviews.Title: “only stay here if all hotels in hong kong are fully booked”
Reviews.Author: holycow248
Reviews.Content: i just checked in yesterday afternoon, i am still here because it's a business trip and i have to run in and out and don't have time to make alternative arrangements. first of all, i paid for the first night of the 4 nights i'm supposed to be here when i booked the room, BUT they never told me there was a 200 odd dollar surcharge per night, not even in their confirmation letter. when i checked in they made me pay for the other 3 days i'm supposed to be here all at once in full before they gave me my keycard. it was then they told me about the surcharge which i never heard of till i checked in. it's really frustrating especially when you are on a trip and you have to deal with surprises like this. so got to my room, took a shower and the drains were clogged so the whole entire bathroom floor was flooded when i finished showering. i called room service to check on it after i went out, came back took another shower and it's still clogged. plus the towels they offer are old. what kind of service is this? their chain hotel on prat was ranked no. 1 on trip advisor so morrison can't be that bad i thought. this is the worst experience i've ever had, even with sketchy 2 star hotels in china this is far worst.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: lbeachey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had previously stayed at Butterfly on Prat but I wanted to stay on Hong Kong Island so we gave this a try. Check-in is on the third floor but there is always a bellman on the first floor to help you. The one problem I had with check-in is the clerk pushed hard to upsell me to the Deluxe Suite. I am not sure if they were oversold with the class of room I reserved but we said no. The room was reasonably spacious with windows on two sides which made it feel bigger. The bathroom was a little cramped but bigger than the bathroom on Prat. This was a nice place to be based for the shopping and dining my wife and I did. Hotel has wired internet but no wireless but it is complimentary. Safe is too small to fit a laptop which is one of the few negatives I can mention. It was what I expected and I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bzchrmr
Reviews.Content: We arrived exhausted from our overnight flight and travel. Booked on Agoda. Standard room was not ready yet, so they upgraded us to a Deluxe. Location was close to two metro stations, and many tram and bus lines, local markets/restaurants, and Causeway Bay fancy shopping (Time Square). Lovely to be snuggled between the fancy shopping and local, "real" markets where regular folk go. As other reviewers have said, try to secure a room on a higher floor. Just down the street from the hotel is a local open air food market, where we bought fruit to eat in our room. Definitely explore the area for great local restaurants with fresh authentic HK dishes! Considering how expensive HK is, we could not have been happier with our short stay. In fact, later in the week when we returned from a trip to Macau, based on our good experience at Morrison, we decided to stay in another Butterfly location, on Prat. We were not disappointed! We did not try the restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: RidlerGirl67
Reviews.Content: Butterfly is a small boutique chain in Asia that doesn't disappoint. Modern design, sleek appearance and clean lines. Free wifi in lobby plus 2 computers available for guest use. 24-hour attended front door in lobby provides added security. Butterfly on Morisson is a good location, especially for shopping or heading to the race track but convenient to other areas of Hong Kong with transit nearby. Plenty of restaurants, cafes and activities. Great views of Happy Valley Race complex and Time Square shopping less than 5 minute walk. Ask for an upper room if you want a stellar view. Our room was spacious, especially by Hong Kong standards. Corner Room provided two views. Very clean and nicely maintained. Comfortable, firm bed. Good closet space with in-room safe and refrigerator. Desk and sofa all added to make this a good space. Glass bathroom separated by blinds a little unusual for Americans, but it worked. Compact space has all the necessities, shower-only but good size. Superior air conditioning a welcome reprieve from hot and humid days as well. Bottle water, coffee and tea provided daily. We booked through the hotel website and saved quite a bit. Do you homework and you will find good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!! Warning!!”
Reviews.Author: Taro88
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrible! Worst hotel Ive ever fayed in and I've stayed in ALOT! Staff are rude, cleaning staff tend to walk into your room without waiting, bedrooms were filthy, checking in took over an hour(seriiously!), reception room smelt so bad(Strong perfume smell) I could barely breathe it was that bad and only escape was the lift to the ground floor where the entrance is and the lift takes forever. It broke down on several occasions while we were there, waited nearly 10mins for it once! Terrible service, bad management, terrible hotel. Over priced too! Won't be staying ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: regular-traveller25
Reviews.Content: Stayted here 2 nights, nothing 'amazing" but quite solid. Good location, nice room, helpful staff. Only con, is that for same money can find similar hotel in similar area but with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it we ll be back”
Reviews.Author: amitred
Reviews.Content: good hotel staff all our requests were taken care of. room was provided to us on 22 floor on our request ,with a good view.check in was done 2 hrs before their normal check in time as we reached early.a complimentary wine bottle was provided as it was my wife's Bday.clean hotel with good interiors,only regret ,NO room service.overall a very pleasant stay .bathroom is transperant so would not recommend it to ppl other than couples

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSandgroper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights. It is in a great location, at a very good price. Only a casual comfortable walk to Times Square, there were lots of local eateries and a wet market nearby. Anything futher afield could easily be reached by catching the MTR, bus or tram (all within a 5-10 minute walk away). The rooms were fairly small, but as we were out all day it didn't really matter. There were 2 bottles of free water each day, which was fantastic (a bit weird that they were placed in the bathroom above the toilet, but we were told that is the standard). The bathroom/toilet area was very small. However, the glass door to the shower recess was great because it meant there was no need to fight off a sticky shower curtain! The bathroom door was glass and even with the blinds closed, you want to make sure you are either sharing with a partner/spouse, otherwise you might still get an eye full through the gap. The staff were polite... when a friend had a medical emergency they were able to assist in getting medical attention. Room safe was handy. Flat screen TV was good. Free internet access using the two lobby computers (but it would be good if they enforced a time limit as we were queued up waiting for over half an hour before we gave up). I rate a hotel room based on the distance to the train system, the price and cleanliness. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard”
Reviews.Author: airSN
Reviews.Content: 1.The room was small and dirty especially under bed.  2. Amenities are not full, I really need cotton bud but they don't service.  3. If they can promote the interesting around hotel ,it's must be better.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: j147
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this hotel. It is very convenient that is in shopping area. Times Square shopping mall is just within 10 mins walking distance. The room although is small (like previous some people said) but we both think it is in good size. Room is bright and the bed is comfortable. Front desk staff is friendly. We both particular like the area with many choices of restaurants and the nearby wet market. We just love this city and love this place. Definitely will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for few nights in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PAULINA_roma
Reviews.Content: I've spent in Butterfly 4 nights in the middle of june in a deluxe room on 17th floor and it was great, very modern, very clean, with very nice bathroom, and confortable bed. i actually thought it would be much smaller ( i read the rewievs before), but it was big enough - there was also a place for a sofa, and small desk. all the staff was very polite and ready to help. in the 3rd floor where the reception is, you can use wifi and mac computer free of charge. the location is perfect - 5 min walk from MTR ( times square), very near to shops, markets, restaurants. i hope to go back to Hong Kong soon and I'll stay in Butterly hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Impressive”
Reviews.Author: mariaRahim
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We totally love love it. Here's why: 1. We were given a room on the 17th floor with a great view of the mountains. 2. The room were very well furnished and the deco is very European style. 3. The toilet is made of glass walls and it is actually kind of fun and interesting. 4. The location is soo soo good with 5 minutes from Times Square and that means close to everything else like MTR, SOGO and such. 5. Service is fantastic. No fuss no frills. All request attended to promptly. Very helpful. 6. Internet free (wifi) at lobby and one MAC PC at the receptionist. No issue because we didnt have anyone vying it with us during the times we wanted to use. 7. Good price! 8. Food is located very near around the hotel. 7-11 is a few doors away. Not for fussy people or particular people who minds about having only 2 service lift, not soo soft beds etc etc. For us, it met all the other important aspects and that is enough. =D

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great interior but not an impressive front door”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAsiaTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our HK leg of a China trip this year. The main purpose is for its location which is close to all shopping in Wanchai, Causeway Bay (SOGO shopping etc) and Times Square. There are also great food all around you, but you do need to look for these. The hotel is close to Happy Valley race course so you can visit this for the Wed night races (recommended - only HKD$20 per person and you can pay using your Octopus multi-purpose MRT card). As for the hotel, we originally got allocated a 5th floor room. As I am a light sleeper, I found the room very noisy as you can hear the buses and cars accelerate and brake like you were outside. So thinking about the busy shopping ahead and the 4 weeks of holiday ahead, I asked for a room change. As expected, I wasnt able to change that same night (8pm already!) but they said I can be allocated a room further up the next night. This was provided without fuss and we really appreciated the friendly service desk staff. As for the room up on level 23 (!!) the next day, the only hiccup was that we were allocated a Twin share room when we specifically asked for a double bed arrangement. This was fixed almost immediately after we called. The room service attendant came in and re-arranged the bed attaching them together. Other good things about the hotel - DVD player, modern furnishings, comfortable bed (s bit hard for westerners), free internet access if you have a cable & modern bathroom. There is free internet kiosks on level 6 where the reception is located. Bad things - well.... as per my title... the hotel is located on a restricted traffic zone so not all cars can stop in front. But we were picked up from there on the last day only by brute force as we didnt care. Not many taxi's were willing to stop right in front of the hotel. You need to ask the taxi to drop you off at the South Pacific Hotel where there is room to stop. Then you need to walk 50m down Morrison rd to the small entrance of the hotel. It doesnt look impressive at all. But guess you're not there to look at the entrance of the hotel right?!?!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at Butterfly on Morrison - 6D5N”
Reviews.Author: jenlkj
Reviews.Content: Stay at hotel for 5 nights. Taxi driver dont know this hotel so asked them to stop at South Pacific Hotel then walk <2mins to hotel front. Can leave luaggage at 1st floor & they'll send to yr room after u check-in at 3rd floor. Only 1 notebook available for guest's use but can get receptionist help to check on their computer if they're not busy. 2 lifts only so wait can be long when one of them is under service. Hotel is new, basic room size is just nice for us. Cons 1) each room is given 4 soft pillows. Even 2 pilliows may still not be comfortable so maybe top-up with bath towel will help 2) Not for light sleeper as can hear the tap on/off when next room/upstair is bathing. I stay on 6th floor so can hear traffic downstair from 7plus in the morning. The lift is outside the lift so can hear lift sound & sometimes smell ppl smoking.But still bearable as we're out most of the time . 3) Walk to Causeway bay mrt is abt 10-15min & very tiring esp on yr way back to hotel. 4) Need to ask for items when Housekeeping "forget" to re-fill. Pros 1) 5mins to Times Square 2) Hotel is abt 5mins to nearby local market & eating place. 3) Just one bus stop away fr Hom Hum MTR if you taking train to Shenzhen. 4) 5 mins walk to Happy Valley Racecourse bus-stop & then few stops away to Ocean Park. 5) Tram is abt 5 min walk fr Hotel - can take tram to Wan Chai mtr to take mtr to elsewhere if dont want to walk to CWB mtr. Paid good price for the location as i booked early so ok. May stay this hotel again if price is good but likely to try other hotel nearer to mtr in next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_133
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this small hotel room, everything is fine, the bed is comfortable, the network is good, the traffic is a little bit inconvenient but the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable, would return.”
Reviews.Author: JuniperJack
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night, asked for a high floor and was given 27th. Staff was helpful on check-in, shame no breakfast. Free wired internet. clean room and I believe value for money, would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TJRTravel
Reviews.Content: Well located near Times Square, Causeway bay area, and MTR station. Price was reasonable for a Saturday night in Hong Kong and we were upgraded when we checked in. No breakfast or wifi but has wired internet connection for computer in room. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: staycation79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Superior room. Great tips from the previous reviewer islandkat! Most taxi drivers will know the South Pacific Hotel. Wireless broadband advertised is only at the Reception area, most of the rooms use free cabled broadband. One way around this is to bring your own router if you have devices that only use wifi. There is an ipod dock in the room which we didn't use. And the tv comes with a dvd player if you get bored of the cable channels. There is street food nearby so you will not go hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Eh81
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel: -it was noicy. Single glass, so street noice is very present if you are on one of the lower levels -You could also clearly hear everthing in the hall way, this includes the elevator when it stops -the bed was too hard. The first two nights I woke up from pain. I switched sides and then it was just OK. -The hotel seemed to be used for prostitution as well. Seen twice. -location is OK,

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: CarstenWatsons
Reviews.Content: Well before my expectations were not high. But when i arrived ( a bitcomplicated to find for the Taxi driver) i was enthusiastic! The room in 9th floor,at the edge of the building, Two huge windows on both sides. View to Happey Valley and Canal Road. Interiour design is modern,high quality and everything you need.Gratis; two Bottles of Water. Water cooking unit,Flatscreen TV and the best gratis Broadband Internet Access! Location: Tram in front of Door,Bus Stop too. MTR Causeway Bay via Time Square Shopping Mall; a walk within 5 Min. Perfect Hotel for me. Ok, no breakfast available in Hotel, but if you're happy with the coffe or Tea in Room and maybe some Sandwich from 7 Eleven ( 4 Stores around! )it's ok. Or choose one of the small Resto's for breakfast. My Opinon of this Hotel. Choose Superiour- or deLuxe Room!Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Tidy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Tweaker108
Reviews.Content: I liked the location - only five minutes to walk to MTR not 15 as others have said. All was efficiently organised and the room was clean and tidy.- very happy to be up on the 21st floor and away form the street. Only poor experience was the soundproofing between me and the neighboring room seemed to be very inadequate. Could hear them talking let alone once they started on the loud stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - service, room, overall experience”
Reviews.Author: Shallowpockets
