Reviews.Content: I would definiely stay here again. Room was clean and new. It was quiet. The oval shape of the room was intriguing. The bathroom was spacious and everything worked great. A nice big rain showerhead. Bed was comfortable. We were on the 12th floor. The first glimpse out our window and a big hawk was sailing between the buildings below us. Elevators were frequent and fast. WiFi in room only per cable hookup in room, but free Wifi with their computers or your own laptop in lobby. Of many rooms we have stayed in over the years, I give this a 95%.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: CathyM20
Reviews.Content: Spent a really relaxing holidays in the Butterfly hotel. The deluxe room I stayed was clean, comfortable with beautiful modern décor, and I especially enjoy the wide and gorgeous window view. The hotel itself is very well located, just a little walk from the railway and various bus stations. Great staff, great service, great food around, would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CocoChung
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stayed in butterfly. At first I thought it was only one of those smaller new hotels in convenient district, but the actual experience is amazing. The hotel location is perfect, it’s very close to Times Square HK and other shops & malls in the district. But my favorite part is that we could easily find a lot of eateries around no matter in the early morning or deep in the midnight. We even got desserts’ recommendation from the hotel staff, and that was a really good one. The hotel itself has nice interior design, room was relaxing and comfortable with a lovely view over Causeway Bay. Personally I think it was a great experience of true HK city life.

Reviews.Title: “Not good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ramblin_poodle
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels in HK, and this is probably the most overpriced for the facilities provided. I paid US$350 for a tiny room {even though I was upgraded to the largest room!} with NO minibar, NO room service, no fridge to store any bought drinks, not even any snacks in the room. As I came in on a late flight exhausted, this was not good. Also there's no parking out the front so I had to haul a lot of luggage up to reception which I was not helped with. Also I could hear everything going on in the corridor. There are hotels in HK that are a lot cheaper and offer a lot more. On the plus side, the room does have a dvd player.. but I hardly think that makes up for it. If it were in a cheaper price bracket, I'd expect all of these things and the hotel would be excellent compared to others in that bracket, but this price is unjustifiable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: djmalik2
Reviews.Content: It was really nice staying at the hotel and all the staff was very polite, cooperative and helpful. I would surely recommend it to my other friends and it will be my first priority for my future visits as well

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Doglover85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during last Xmas, it was surprisingly good, location is simply perfect, n very nice service 2. Think it should possess a better ranking on tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, cheap bill!”
Reviews.Author: Ambra_g
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days on my arrival in Hong Kong. The position was very central and allowed me to reach every interesting spot in the city very quickly. The neighborhood was also nice with restaurants and massage centers open til late. The room was little, but I loved the style: essential, yet elegant, modern...and clean. From my window I could see such a wonderful view...

Reviews.Title: “new boutique hotel, very good situation close to Shopping malls”
Reviews.Author: ML2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty new and is kept perfectly clean. The rooms are not huge (as in most hotels in Hong kong) but big enough, and very quiet, even though the hotel is located on a busy street. Bathroom is very modern and super clean. Internet is free inside the bedroom (here again....it is not the case in most HK hotels) But the best of all is its situation: 5 minutes walk to Time Square (shopping, dining...). After coming to Hong Kong for more than 15 times on "shopping week ends", I guess I have found the perfect hotel in terms of price/location/cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSquirell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during 2011 Chinese New Year. The hotel interior is modern, but the glass door to the bathroom is quite uncomfortable....but it depends:)I got the room in the lower floor, so the was no view...only the tubes, so if possible ask for the upper floor. The location is ok, about 20 minutes walk to metro station, and the bus station is near. You can go on foot to harbour and to big shopping malls. There are a lot of places to eat nearby and very nice small market also is very close. The room was clean, bed was big and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice staff & clean room”
Reviews.Author: Thomaz888
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room but was offered a penthouse suite for a small fee which we found was very resonable. Butterfly on Morrison is a nice boutique hotel with a staff that will try to help you find anything. They helped me find a nice dum sum place and the time of the horse racing. The room design is modernI and the amenities are excellent for Hong Kong standards, definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor housekeeping, dirty and cold rooms; but good bell service!”
Reviews.Author: hunni8bear
Reviews.Content: Pros: Brisk 5 minute walk to Times Square Lane Crawford buidling. Near area with food markets by day and by night, an alley that changes into affordable, cheap restaurants that cook fresh seafood chosen from the front of the restaurant. Bellboy service was great,. Cons: Booked on Booking.com over 6 months prior to trip for a Deluxe Room with King size bed. We were told on arrival that they did not have the room available and that they only had a Superior Twin Room (lower ranking) available. The choice we had was to either take it or not have a hotel at all. They did not offer to give it to us for a lower price, even though it is a cheaper room than what we had paid to stay in. When we got there, the room was very filthy. The carpet was stained and filled with debris. We were greeted with 2 scout boy twin beds. The bathroom floors were filthy like an old gym locker room, to the point where I was only able to bear t aking a shower, by laying a towel on the shower floor to step on! The bathroom not only had the one clear glass door but also had a section that was a sliding wall/door with no lock. Very poor lighting. The free wired internet came with a 3 inch LAN cable that did not allow for you to even pull your laptop any closer to you! The dishonesty in the staff was unremarkable! We complained that the heat was not working. There was only cold wind blowing. The staff that came up avoided very much from telling us that the switch on the wall was really only for a fan/airconditioner and that in fact, there really was no heat! It took for me to finally blatantly state that "So you mean there is actually no heat?" that he sheepishly nodded. No wonder it was warmer when I actually turned the entire thing off! I was only adjusting the force of the cold fan! Then we were told that they ran out of portable heaters for the night too! I called down to the service desk to complain that night and demanded to be put back in the class of room I had booked for and they agreed! However, there was no attempt on their part to apologize or deduct the difference in room price. I ended up still paying the price of a deluxe room the night that we slept in a superior twim bed room! I suspect they gave our room out to walk in last minute guests, possibly charging them more, while they sent us to sleep in a lower class room but for the price of the higher class room. Makes me wonder if the staff pocket the difference in money made. That way, they can earn the price of 2 nights worth of deluxe room fee in one night! I am quite angry with this, as we were very tired by the time we came to thsi hotel. We had just finished 2 and half weeks of going from city to city and was really looking forward to the last 3 days in hong kong for our pre-honeymoon, hoping to get some better rest. All in all the hotel was a major dissappointment. We stayed at their Pratt location the week before, and although we were not impressed by the attitude of their staff, it was at least cleaner, given we had booked a lower class room from them than at Morrison. They didn't even have a microwave, when Pratt did in their Superior room!

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly, if only you can fly higher!”
Reviews.Author: Ken N
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last year Nov 2010 got a deal at HKD650 per night for 4 nights. Airport transfer was smooth, took a 7 seater limo. Because the hotel does not have parking outside the front entrance which is for bus, the driver had to park behind the alley, and we used the car park bay to enter the front entrance. The concierge didn't helped us with the luggage (I had my aging mom and dad with me.) and my wife, so we managed it ourselves. I noticed the concierge sometimes don't open the door for the guests. Checking in not that smooth, we have to wait like 15 minutes, because the room was not ready. One was ready which I gave it to my parent, so they went up first. After 35mins later, I asked the front desk lady, she told me "oh, it's ready!" I wished they can be more initiative to inform us rather than we ask them..... Got into the room, it was very clean, a bit small as we took the Standard room. Room ain't that sound proof, you can hear your neighbor chatting at night and also the lift entrance sound. Free Internet for those who brought their notebooks, wish they had Wi-fi instead, because you can see from the photos I upload, it's pretty lack of space there! The hotel is located between Causeway Bay and Wan Chai, so if you can walk and it's not an issue to you to reach Causeway Bay MTR (which is about 10minutes away and 5 mins to Time Square Mall). The nearest taxi stand is at the South China Hotel which has taxi stand, it's just few seconds away. Lots of food around, and also the wet market which is a must see for others! fresh fruits etc all available. If you are traveling alone or with spouse and don't mind a bit walk, then this hotel is for you. It's value for money and the hotel is quite new and very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for tandems”
Reviews.Author: mmmeldel
Reviews.Content: Service was pretty good. They assisted us in everything that we needed. I requested for a queen sized bed when i booked online but got 2 single beds instead when we checked in because there were a lot of people booked in that hotel for the weekend and that was the only room that was available. The next day, we transferred rooms and finally got our bed right. We stayed on the 27th floor and the view was spectacular. We could see the horse race track from our room. The room itself was a bit small, but its just the right size for 2-3 ppl max. I liked that the room had a modern feel. The bathroom was clean, but the doors were made of frosted glass so your roommate would definitely see your silhouette while you shower. Haha! The location of the hotel is a 5 minute walk to Times Square and the Causeway Bay MTR. The room rates are pretty good, but the additional charges kinda surprised me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business and independent travelers”
Reviews.Author: circusliz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Butterfly on Morrison for 8 nights in late January 2011. The hotel was perfect for us: within our budget, centrally located, and with easy access to nightlife and public transportation. Our room was nice and clean, and plenty big for the two of us (although certainly not spacious, but as city dwellers we're very used to sharing cramped quarters), with a nice bathroom and amenities, including free internet (cable, not wireless). We put out the extra $50/night for a top floor room, and the 180 degree view was AMAZING!! We looked out over the raceway, Causeway Bay, and the mountains. It was very pretty at night! We spent a lot of time walking around the hotel -- Wanchai is about 10 min away, the Causeway Bay MTR is about 5 min. We walked all the way to Soho several times -- maybe 30 minutes? Pretty much anything and everything we wanted was within walking distance. And the nearby MTR and trams made getting everywhere else very easy. With that said, this is not a hotel for travelers who liked to be coddled by hotel staff. There's no hotel restaurant, conceirge, travel desk, etc. Although hotel staff were lovely (and the cleaning staff was very nice to hang around to clean our room even when we didn't leave the room until 2pm!), they pretty much checked us in and left us alone. I'm sure they would have been happy to answer any questions, but otherwise we were on our own. We're very independent travelers, so this was just fine by us (I actually don't like overly attentive hotel staff!), but if you're a timid traveler who needs some handholding then this might not be the best hotel for you. Overall we loved our stay at the Butterfly on Morrison, and will certainly stay there again should we pass through Hong Kong again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaidAgain
Reviews.Content: Great stay. I stayed at Butterfly on Morrison during CNY. A little expensive, but this was peak rates. Hotel is new, clean, convenient location in Wanchai / CWB. I was upgraded to Deluxe Room. Room was small, like many in HK. But layout was very good and I had no problems. Bed was great... firm, but not rock hard. Bath was "roomy" for HK. Not many frills..... but very convenient. For instance.... the entrance is right on road. Really 5 steps from the street to the elevators. So if you prefer walking through a grand lobby and getting of the "stroking" from hotel employees.... this is not the place. For me, this is much better. I did not try the restuarant. Check in/out was simply and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: auripa
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in the city center, I was only there two nights but I would be happy for a week. The staff was friendly and also helped me to contact my friends in Hong Kong. The room was clean and comfortable with beautiful views over the city. Excellent value for money I will recommend Butterfly On Morrison Hotel to my friends and definitely come back. Thank you for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: gardengnome49
Reviews.Content: Clean smart room on the 20th floor. Extremely comfortable bed. Staff were friendly and helpful. MTR is close at hand but like many Hong Kong stations quite a walk from the entrance to the train. Worth getting to grips with the trams and buses - get an Octopus card or Add Value to the Aiport Express card. The BEST feature is the Chung Kee Dessert Restaurant which serves nothing but delicious desserts ( nearby next to the flyover). Happy Valley Racecourse is in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good value, limited service”
Reviews.Author: JDfromUSA
Reviews.Content: In the past I stayed at many of the high end hotels in Hong Kong but recently have been staying at more affordable properties. When selecting a hotel I look for those which have recently updated rooms and a location convenient for walking around - with great value. The Butterfly on Morrison opened in September 2009 and offers modern rooms with simple boutique decor - including pedestal sinks, marble tile, rain shower, dark woods and hip colors. I stayed in the Deluxe room which are located at the ends of the narrow building so you get windows on both sides of the room. This gave the room a larger feel. While the rooms are small I did not feel cramped and had plenty of room for my 2 suitcases. The room has a small desk for my laptop and Internet access with very good speed. While overall I felt the room was clean, more attention is needed to areas not always noticed by housekeeping, such as vacuuming the edge of carpet near walls and dusting the lamps. The location is within a 5 minute walk to Hong Kong's vibrant shopping district and access to the MTR subway is in the Times Square mall, although you need to walk another 10 minutes underground to get to trains. Don't expect a high level of service. The staff was helpful but not the type to pamper you. I am not one to care about pampering, I just want an iron brought to the room in a few minutes, which they did. Because there are bus stops in front of the hotel you will need to be dropped off at the corner of the block, which is very close. Overall, a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean and with a modern feel”
Reviews.Author: NL_awt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last month. It is a nicely decorated hotel. The rooms are OK, with good beds, a good shower (very important) and are very clean. We would recommend the hotel and we will come back on a next visit of HK.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: jason416
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Butterfly on Morrison to be close to relatives and the Wan Chai Immigration Office. 1. Location: While not beside an MTR station, it is a few minutes' walk away from the MTR. I personally walked along Sharp Street West, crossed at the nearest intersection (either to the North or South will do), then found Sharp Streest West and found my way to Times Square. There are other ways to get to the metro and you can easily figure them out. I highly recommend for a cheap but good eats to check out the Bowrington Market Cooked Food Centre down on Wan Chai Road. US$2-3 for breakfast and you're set.. 2. Hotel: Very clean, modern and trendy. Nothing terrible about the service but nothing special either. Upon check-in on the 3rd floor reception, I was told no non-smoking superior rooms were available and my tour company said it didn't specify I wanted a non-smoking room. I never told them I needed a non-smoking room so I'm not sure why they would bring it up in that context. I begrudingly upgraded to a deluxe room for HK$200 extra a night because I was tired and didn't want to argue. Two laptops for free internet in the lobby. 3. Room: My room was 2001 - a deluxe room on the 20th floor very close to the elevator. Very trendy, nice new carpet, small work desk, alarm clock, LCD screen TV, firm but comfortable bed with standard white HK bedding. Huge ceiling to floor windows with a small 2 person couch on one end. Adequate closet space, safe and a handy refrigerator as well. Washrooms only include a shower (with rainfall shower and regular shower head), sink, and toilet. No robes, no sandals - the former being very odd in Asia. Air conditioning very strong. Walls must be poorly insulated because I could hear the doors closing beside me, conversations outside, as well as the sound of people coming in and out of the elevator. You can hear the traffic outside but its nothing unbearable if you've lived in a big city. 4. Service - The last reviewer is correct in that there's very little sense of feeling welcome in this hotel. It is efficient though, the concierge and reception wasn't rude but I get the sense that these small boutique hotels/servied apartments in HK are all like this. I've stayed at the Hotel Benito for example and it was efficient - nothing more and nothing less. No gym either. So you're really just staying for a place to crash. 5. Final thoughts - I have stayed in a range of hotels in Hong Kong from the Langham Place in Mongkok to the Holiday Inn Express right beside Causeway Bay on Russell Street. If I were to stay again in Causeway Bay/Wan Chai, I'd prefer to be at the Holiday Inn Express even if it isn't as modern and trendy, it's a few more steps closer to the action in CWB and I'd pay the extra little bit for being a few hundred metres closer to the actionin the future.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean rooms but lack of human touch”
Reviews.Author: blueariel
Reviews.Content: Besides Conrad in HK, i have never experience much customer service when i stayed in hotels in there. Maybe thats the norm(little/unfriendly svs in HK hotels?)--butterfly on morrison proves to be the same as well. Before we stayed at Butterfly, we came from a little hostel in Beijing whereby the service was full of warmth and human touch. However, things seem to be lacking at Butterfly. On many occassion, i smiled at the guy at the door but i got a cold stare back. I opened my own door and said thank you to him(he didnt help) and again, more cold stare. Upon check out, i had 4 luggages and it was the same as well. Stares. Check in staffs are ok if you dont have much expectation. They are just "normal" standards. We were upgraded to a delux room and were quite happy with the room-Sony tv, clean rooms, racecourse view n very boutique hotel feel! I was quite happy with the size of the room-This is HK, so dont expect too much space unless you're willing to pay. One thing that i am particular is the pillow. It was too soft even though i stacked two pillows together. Bad for my neck. I asked for a harder pillow but unfortunately, they didnt have it but they were nice enough to offer me extra pillows. Most of the taxis we took know this hotel. If not, you can tell them in Cantonese-"Mo-Ri-Sen san dou-Fu Dip zhao dim". I dont know the best cantonese but i managed to get around with that.=D Location was good! I love to stay on HK island side and we were very near causeway bay. it was very quiet at night and i had gd sleep every night. I will stay in this no fuss hotel again if they dont increase their price!

Reviews.Title: “Not well known but everyone will soon...”
Reviews.Author: chasiubaau
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasent stay and in terms of HK standards its value for money, considering many places in Kowloon are charging more then this place (I consider HK Island a better place to stay then Kowloon) and it's right next to Times Square shopping mall, some great restaurant's and a 10 min walk to Causeway Bay MTR station. Finding the place can be a bit hard (there sign is really small), but if you ask for South Pacific Hotel, walk 20 meters down then you'll find it. As the hotel is fairly new, so too are the rooms and the staff are quick to make a good early impression. Our superior room had a nice 32" LCD Samsung, well equiped bathroom (aside from the single bath soap) and although the room was small was big enough to facilitate all our needs. In conclusion I would highly recommend Butterfly on Morrison to singles, couples and 2+2 families. It's a young and new hotel but if they keep this up I'm sure their reputation will soon be well known.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Too Much - And You'll Be Fine”
Reviews.Author: positivity
Reviews.Content: Decided to book a 2-nights' stay at Butterfly on Morrison based on tripadvisor reviews. Discounted rate via a 3-party site was attractive. My stay in summary: - Taxi driver from Hong Kong station was not aware of hotel. But frontage was visible from Morrison Hill Road, so this was not a major issue. - As another reviewer had pointed out, there is a bus-stop right in front of the hotel. As such, the taxi had to stop about 20-30m away at the South Pacific.Hotel next door. A minor hassle. - Lobby at 3rd floor was clean, pleasant and modern. Staff was efficient and offered to upgrade me to a "superior" room. She did highlight that it was equipped with facilities for the handicap. Again, not an issue for me. - Room was generally larger than standard HK hotels to ensure manoeuvrability for the handicap, while layout and amenities were designed to provide ease of reach. Washbasin was however incredibly small and did not come with a mixer for hot and cold water. Can imagine that this will be an issue in winter. - Neatives - aircon control didn't seem to work. It either fluctuated from very cold to warm. Road noise was apparent at night which for a light sleeper meant waking up every once in a while. Walls were also thin and you could hear your neighbout shutting the closet door or turning on the taps. Other than that, the hotel was as expected for a boutique setup. The issue of not being able to flag a cab in front of the hotel may be a concern to visitors with bulky luggages. I did not manage to catch a taxi during peak hours and had to walk to the Times Sq MTR in formal dining attire. The free in-room broadnet internet had worked well on the 1st night but for some reason or other, did not on the 2nd night. - All in all, good for a short stay. Location is a plus. Times Sq is a short distance away. Don't expect too much and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “I thought this was a great hotel for the...”
Reviews.Author: Clr4taoff
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great hotel for the price. The service was very friendly and helpful. It was everything it was advertised as. Even though it may not be in the central area, public transportation is so cheap and easy to get around very quickly. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: kangarooHZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights from 10 Sept to 13 Sept. The service is really incredible. Upon arrival in the airport bus, immediately the hotel staff helped to carry my luggage. Very polite as well. However the reception is located on 3rd floor instead of 1st but then it is not a problem. The only thing i don't like is the lift is slow. In the room there is no toothbrush and paste, i didnt know i have to request form the hotel staff till i read the previous review, i think they are into the environmental friendly thus they didnt provide it in the room only upon request. Not a problem coz i brought along mine. Bed is comfy room is nice. Hotel is quite near to times square. I recommend this hotel to all. I will not return to this hotel as I always stay at different hotel when i go Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loopins
Reviews.Content: I've not stayed in other hotels in HK so cannot do a comparison. However this hotel was okay generally. The room is quite small however and the shower for a larger person is to be honest very very small. For us the internet was not working and it seems that HK has some pay wireless system all over the place this is quite disappointing for a developed city. We were located on the 9th Floor so the view was non existent so if your expecting a view make sure you get a room much higher up. The location was convenient and good. Don't expect much and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasa99
Reviews.Content: Locate in Causeway Bay, 5 mins walk to Causeway MTR Station (Time Square exit). Next to South Pacific Hotel. Close to all shopping areas and restaurant. Nice staff. Good Value to stay. Size of bedroom is not too big, but not too bad according to Hong Kong's standard. Will consider to stay again. All rooms are good decor, trendy and clean. However, glass door in bathroom which make family stay with kids not convenience. No facilities. Need to pay for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jovanpuyo
Reviews.Content: The Staff The staff is OK. They're not as warm as with other hotels I've tried but they're definitely not rude. The girls in the reception are cute ;). They lent us their umbrella when it was raining. The Room We got a superior room and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with how it looked. It was very nice, comfortable and very clean. This is definitely not a cookie-cutter room. The Bathroom The bathroom was small but OK. The doors were made of glass so you can actually see through what's inside if you want. The Bed The bed was comfortable. Too bad I can't say the same for the pillows. Those were lame. The Location - The hotel is near the corner of Morrison Hill Road and Leighton Road in Wan Chai. - It's directly in front of a bus stop. Because of this, taxis won't drop you off or pick you up at the front door. You will have to walk to the corner (Sharp Street) to get one. - Times Square (and the entrance to the Causeway Bay MTR) is just 10 minutes walk from the hotel BUT you may have to walk through a wet market to go there (Wan Chai Road). This may be an adventure for some and a turn off for others. - There's not much variety in terms of cheap restaurants within the vicinity of the hotel. We came upon two restaurants that serve noodles but their english menu is very limited. - There's a 7-11 two blocks away going to Hennessy Road. For the price, this hotel is worth it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: catherinalove
Reviews.Content: Since I was with girlfriends on a shopping trip, we were looking for a hotel that would not bust our budgets. I was also bent on staying at Causeway Bay since I had always stayed at the Tsim Sha Tsui area whenever in HK. This boutique hotel seemed to be the answer. The hotel is a short taxi ride away from the airport express terminal in HK Island. The cab stops at the block, since the hotel entrance is in front of the bus stops. Aside from the hotel room, don't expect any other useful amenities. No pool, no room service, etc. The toiletries smell great though, and the free bottled water is large enough. We had a good view of the hills and the Happy Valley racetrack. Good rainshower head and massage head. Modern fixtures in the toilet. I couldn't understand the transparent glass doors to the toilet though.They should have been smoked for privacy. The towels were also threadbare, and the carpet didn't look clean. The room and the beds were too tiny, even for HK standards, and I bumped my head 5 times while getting something out of the closet. There was no nightlife or good restaurants within walking distance, but it's so easy to get a cab or walk to the mtr. OK for the price, but the hotel can improve on certain aspects just by carefully thinking things through.

Reviews.Title: “i dont mind staying here again”
Reviews.Author: bobjrjr
Reviews.Content: its a new hotel so its quite a plush hotel. stayed here for 3nights but only pay for 2. i would say this hotel is located within causeway bay and wanchai so everything is within walking distance. the room is a bit small cos i bump into the chair of the room three times in 1 night. apart from that, i do enjoy my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyNg
Reviews.Content: It's a nice neat little hotel in Causeway Bay area, one of the most live area in Hong Kong. The location just behind Times Square makes it so convenient and easy to get around. MTR station also located at the Times Square. A lot of interesting local restaurant and shops nearby. One of the must try transportation is Ding Ding or the tram. There's a tram stop within walking distance from this hotel. There is no complaint for this hotel except 1, the sound of the shower water from next door room can be annoying in the night. Looks like there is no soundsproof in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms spoiled by reception staffs' bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: mich3lle
Reviews.Content: Received by friendly concierge staff at lobby. Was told during check-in there were no double-bed rooms left so settled with one with disabled facilities, i.e. tiny sink. Room was lovely but reception staff were unpleasant and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Butterfly!”
Reviews.Author: Indian_Baldie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Butterfly for 3 days in late June 2010. We arrived around 10pm after a very very long flight. The lobby is on the 3rd floor, which may be off-putting to some, but there is someone at street level to assist you 24hrs a day. Check in was no issue and the room was clean and comfortable. For Hong Kong, the room is good size with all the amenities. The hotel itself is about a 5-10 min to Times Square and a 15min taxi (depending on traffic) to IFC and the ferries to Kowloon and the Peak. Ideal location if you ask me. If you are looking for a boutique hotel in Hong Kong, I highly recommend the Butterfly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: organicf
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for Hong Kong. We arrived around 2 pm and were immediately upgraded to a suite on the 11th floor. The room was clean, modern, and very spacious (for HK standards). Even from the 11th floor, we had great views of the city as the room contained floor-to-ceiling windows. The layout was very practical with a walk through bathroom, closet w/safe and min-fridge and a very nice wall mounted flat-panel TV. We borrowed a couple of DVD's from the front desk one night - which was great as it was pouring down rain and we just wanted to stay in. The staff are very friendly and their English, very good. We arranged a few things with them and asked for change (for the trams) a couple of times - they were always extremely friendly and helpful. The location is also very good. We liked staying a bit out of Central and this is a good place to be in "the thick of it" while still being out just a bit. The subway is nearby (about a 10 minute walk to the Times Square Mall) but we found the trams even more convenient and much cheaper. The nearest tram stop is about 3 min from the hotel and runs constantly. I highly recommend this hotel. Unless you need room service and lots of amenities (like a pool and spa), you will be very happy here. Great location, friendly staff, and spacious clean and modern rooms. What's not to love!! When we come back to Hong Kong, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for price”
Reviews.Author: seafoodben
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and had a great experience. # Positives: - Location is great, walking distance to Causeway MRT (times sq exit closest), close to many places to eat and shop. - Price especially for HK, I got it for about $58 a night, which I thought was well worth it - Rooms, small yes, but clean with nice bathroom. Perfect for a couple, may be awkward if just traveling with friends however. But I loved it # Negatives: - Staff was very nice, but not very helpful when I asked questions about the area. I think this was a language barrier if anything. - No WiFi in the room - No gym/pool Overall excellent stay for the price. Especially if you are like us and traveled for wandering around HK and eating the food. Location is ideal for this, but without pool/gym (if that's important for you). But for the price, hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “perfect space planning”
Reviews.Author: mayurindia
Reviews.Content: any one who has travelled to hong kong will know that the hotel rooms are tinier than you expect - but the space planning at the tiny rooms in butterfly is credible. Rooms are modern, trendy, clean, flat screens, location of the hotel is good - however it's a limited service boutique hotel. We were there during the Mega Show and the staff was very helpful in accommodating and storing the tons of samples we were carrying

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel near Causeway Bay MTR”
Reviews.Author: pumpapple2002
Reviews.Content: Great 3 star hotel and no frills.Walking distance to Time Square shopping centre (5 minutes)and also the same spot as Causeway bay MTR station.Plenty of foods and 7-11 shop. Small room but very clean with minimalist interior. Walking distance to fruit market and food stalls. LCD tv wih 15 channels is sufficient for us. Each floor only have 4 hotel rooms,therefore waiting for a lift up and down is quite an issue .However,if you are on a holiday ,why worry? Friendly staff.Reception is on 3rd floor. Kent,a concierge help us when we check out to airport by calling us a special taxi which cost us 250 HKD and safe all the hassles.Trip to airport takes us 35 minutes and it was 8 in the morning. Wanna do lots of shopping near Causeway Bay area,make sure you stay in this hotel.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: altrnatif
Reviews.Content: HK is a fantastic place and the Butterfly quite a nice boutique hotel, very nice room, trendy, clean, flat screen. BUT... all rooms are on the street side and those HK busses are buzzing by all night long so if you are a light sleeper bring some earplugs. It is also a very limited service hotel, no grand lobby, check in on 3rd floor, no fitness or pool. Overall OK place and convenient to Time Sq.,

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: andibelanda
Reviews.Content: The goods : - The room is small but new, modern and comfortable - Free and fast internet connection in the room - The staffs are friendly - Location is good, with nearby access to any kind of public transports The downsides : - Taxis can't stop in front of the hotel (legally). - Glass through bathroom door Overall, nice and convenient hotel with good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ongjanice1
Reviews.Content: I've heard great reviews about this boutique hotel from my colleagues & after staying @ this hotel, I must AGREE *2 thumbs up* Plus points :- 1) Concierge very helpful - service with a smile (gave us good recommendation of places to have our meals) 2) Checking in was quick 3) Free internet access 4) The rooms are spacious (pleasantly surprised) - friends (3-4 ppl) are able to hang out in the room without feeling cramp. 5) The room layout & deco is trendy 6) Location of this hotel is near the MTR situated @ Time Square shopping mall - approx. 5-10 mins walk 7) Many eating places (local HKG eating places) around the area 8) Shower area is excellent Areas to improve : 1) To provide disposable slippers 2) To provide bathrobes

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jules_in_Malaysia
Reviews.Content: We went to Hong Kong for Christmas 09 and New Years, stayed a total of 11 nights at Butterfly on Morrison. The hotel is small and does not have a proper driveway entrance. However, you can ask the taxi/shuttle bus to drop you off at South Pacific Hotel and that is just steps away from Butterfly on Morrison. The hotel is really not big but they've come up with very creative use of the limited space. The standard rooms are very functional and just spacious enough for 2 adults. Ours came with a nice chaise and work desk. The bathroom was of good size but the actual shower area was very tiny. Even for normal size people, it will take very careful manuvering to turn around in there. The staff was friendly & very helpful. The "video library" has limited titles, so don't hold your breath to find everything you want to watch. The hotel is near lots of authentic Hong Kong eating places, market and is within 10 minute walk to a reknown shopping Mall - Times Square + MTR Station (Causeway Bay). It's a great place to see old-style Hong Kong shops, living places etc. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the design, but watch the bathroom doors if traveling with friends!”
Reviews.Author: Christianna
Reviews.Content: The nearest MTR stop to here is Times Square, NOT Wanchai. We were amazed at how narrow the tall building was, yet they architects were able to maximize the space. Don't be surprised if the main entrance is just a desk and elevators, since check-in is at the 3/F. Travelled here with a male friend (note: NOT partner, just a buddy), and we specified a superior twin-sharing room with 2 single beds. We were upgraded to the Executive Suite at the 28F and was pleasantly surprised, till we saw that there was only 1 Queen Bed. On our return 4 days after, we got a Deluxe room upgrade. Yes, it finally had TWO single beds, but alas, the bathroom doors were practically see through, and you could hear EVERYTHING from inside, as if there wasn't any door! Other than bathrooms not offering any privacy (if you were with a partner/spouse/fiancee then it would've been perfect), I'd reco this anytime! Delicious street food serving seafood and local fare, plus ice cold San Miguel Beer, is located at the back of the hotel, about 2 minutes away on foot. Of course, the famous Times Square mall and restaurants are just around the corner, not to mention the MTR. Would come back to the Butterfly on my next HK trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Valentine's day”
Reviews.Author: DBTT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Butterfly On Morrison on Valentine's day and took their Valentine's day package with a bottle of wine, chocolates and a bath set with extended stay until 3pm. The price for this was if I recall correctly around 1,000HKD which is reasonable. The room was clean and modern and felt really comfortable. The service was basic and I can't really comment on that after staying only for one night. The location is not as bad as other reviews make it look as it's right next to a major bus route, but the rooms are high enough so even the traffic didn't bother the slightest. I wouldn't exactly call it great value, but if you don't care paying a bit extra for a really comfortable stay, I'd say that this is your place. I would definitely stay there again just because of the extremely comfortable room with windows facing two directions.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hong Kong hotel”
Reviews.Author: canswiss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a full week and really enjoyed the location and the room. We were on the 22nd floor and traffic noise was minimal and not noticed. The hotel and services are simple - don't expect extravagant luxuries here - but the rooms are neatly designed, the bed comfortable, the room spacious enough (especially for HK), and the shower was great! All hotel rooms in HK are small, but the double walls of floor to ceiling windows, the mirrors, and the lighting all help to make the room FEEL more spacious. The bed is high enough off the floor to slide luggage under it. The couch and desk are small, but that helps conserve space - especially with 2 people in the room. The views from the upper floors are good - Happy Valley and the surrounding hills in one direction, WanChai and interesting bldgs in the other. The location near enough to public transport, great area for walking around at all times of day and night, and has a good mix of local and western food/drink/shopping. The local market is great for people and produce watching - look for the VERY fresh seafood (beating fish hearts on display!). The street fish resto (Kiu Kee I think it was called) on the next street over is super for the gastronomically adventurous! A really great meal - have no fear! Follow the street directions advice from other reviews in this column - it is easy to find if you cut directly through the market.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT AND FUNKY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BrettSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Smallish but well very furnished and highly functional room. Great bathroom with spacious shower. 26th floor provided amazing views especially at night. Helpful and friendly staff. Good location. Pricing well below Hong Kong average.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, central location, adequate room size”
Reviews.Author: ScruffSydney
Reviews.Content: Having read all of the reviews on this site, I can concur the following: ROOMS *quite a tight squeeze, we stayed in a deluxe room (280sq feet/26sq mtrs). We had 2 large suitcases, one was placed on the sofa, the other on the floor, leaving hardly much room to walk around. *fantastic shower!!! *sturdy, medium / firm mattress and great pillows!!! *There's a bar fridge, but no mini bar service and no room service *NO privacy in bathrooms. There are venetian blinds, but they only cover one wall of the bathroom, the sides are completely exposed *sink is small *plenty or room in the bathroom for all your products *towel hook is not close enough to the shower, so you need to get out of the shower and walk to it *if you're over 5 foot 11, then the study desk will be too low for you *good consistent WiFi (internet was included for us) LOCATION *easy 7 mins walk to Causeway Bay *taxis will stop on the opposite side of the hotel, not out front *reception is on the 3rd floor *close to shopping, restaurants * Morrison Rd is a VERY busy road. We were on the 22nd floor and we could still hear the hum of the traffic, so ask for the rooms of the highest floors SERVICE *flawless *other reviews complained about slow lifts, we experienced no such issue *efficient, speedy check in/check out * there's a Chinese restaurant on the 1st floor In summary, for AUD120 per night for a 4 day stay, this suited our budget and satisfied our needs. You'd need to spend big bucks if you want a bigger room with a view in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: EUTrav
Reviews.Content: If you get a good deal for this maybe 500HKD-600HKD it is OK. Otherwise, it is pretty average (that said this may pique expectations!) Pros: 1. Relatively short walk to MTR PROVIDED you know your way. Exit A of MTR, walk through or around wet markets for Morrison Hill Road. 2. Modern and relatively newish so things don't look too shabby at all 3. DVD and nice flat screen in room 4. Free broadband in room BUT IT IS not wireless so you are stuck to the desk (I wanted to surf in bed :)) 5. Nice Panasonic cordless phone - better than the usual hotel phones IMO Cons: 1. Well I am staying on the 9th floor and I can tell you the traffic noise is high. I can hear everything so really really bad for light sleepers. Also the elevator door DINGS loudly each time adding to the noise. Reception couldn't help, said they were all that way 2. Lifts are quite slow, wait wait wait etc so with 2 lifts, if you are in a rush, best to plan a few minutes more to wait 3. Small rooms, small shower but if you are just looking for a base to plod out of it should do the trick 4. No room service, no gym I wouldn't stay here again unless they have really good hotel deals. Good Luck with your travels!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for the quality.”
Reviews.Author: franckjb
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel located a few minute away from the MTR (HK metro). Rooms are clean, and could be spacious for hong kong (especially the room number 1 and 6 on each floor). Of course the higher, the better: the street tend to be a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: unclejames
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for ten days. Good things: The rooms are comfy and bright; the bathroom is well equipped with a lovely powerful shower; the bed is comfortable. The hotel is new - very new - and feels like a nice, boutique, hotel. (Curious about the TV choice? You've got a choice of around seven English channels, including BBC World, and a DVD player too). The location is also actually not bad at all; it's a short walk from Causeway Bay MTR, but not a hideous trek; it's also great from the tram system (which is cheaper and rather more fun) - take a Happy Valley tram and get off when the tram turns off the main drag. It's close to quite a few decent places, including a few Starbucks, a number of nice pubs/bars (Innside Out), a splendid sushi place (Sushi One), a decent restaurant (Brunch Club), and a number of 7-Eleven stores. The location is nothing to worry about. Bad things: well, being here for ten days has meant that the small niggles are a little more obvious than most. - the (wired) internet, while normally speedy, is charged-for. My internet booking promised 'free internet', and they waived the charges, but just to warn you. And it regularly - too regularly, for my liking - interrupts your browsing session to ask you to agree to the terms and conditions again. There seems no rhyme or reason why. - the hotel has about five or six rooms on each floor; as a result, the lifts are constantly in use, and they don't appear to have been programmed very intelligently (both haring down to meet you on the ground floor, for example, when one would do the trick quite well). - the desk in the room is too low, or the chair is too high, to be as comfortable as you'd like; if you've thick thighs (and mine are anything but) then you'll find it difficult to work. - and you'll never have to worry about this, but the rooms have great air conditioning if you want it to cool your room down; however, after a night trying to get the room warmer, I discover that actually, their air conditioning units have no heating element in them. If you travel in January, which is really the only time you'll ever need this, then the temperature of your room might fall to, golly, 19 or 18 celsius. The small niggles aside, this hotel gets top marks for a comfortable room, and a good location. Use the trams, not the taxis, and you'll get the most out of Hong Kong. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable room; a bit far from Causeway Bay MTR”
Reviews.Author: honeymanz
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a shopping trip in HK with mum. Stayed at Butterfly on Morrison for 3 nights. To get from the airport to the hotel (or vice versa), you can either take the Airport express to HK station then take a MTR to Causeway Bay station - exit A (Times square) or go to counter 13 in the arrival hall and book a shuttle bus with Vigor which costs about HKD 220 for a return ticket. We went for the latter option because it would be more convenient as we're carrying a few huge luggage. The room was very clean, love the bathroom! One thing that I resent is that there are only 2 lifts available. So very often we had to wait for lift to go up and down. The bellboys and the receptionists are very friendly. They would kindly provide us with maps/directions whenever we need it. There is no courtesy umbrella. So we had to walk under the rain to the nearest convenient store to purchase a new umbrella. The hotel was convenient located near Times square. However, if you get out from the wrong exit (Causeway Bay MTR). you would have wasted a lot of time trying to look for the hotel! We spent 30 minutes walking on a longer route. So make sure you go out from exit A (times square). Then when you are at the shopping mall, turn to your left and you will see a flyover - walk under the flyover and you will see a market nearby. Turn left keep walking till the end and turn to your right again (it's like a U-shape) AND you will see the hotel on your right. Ask the receptionist to show you the correct direction when you arrive. There is also a laptop on level 3 the reception where you can use their free internet to serve the web.

Reviews.Title: “A nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: nutella123
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just been opened few months ago and it is already very popular. It's very central, near Times Square, however if you are travelling with luggage or if you are planning to use a lot MTR is not the best location. The nearest MRT is CauseBay station, following the exit for Time Square. It is a good 10-15 minutes walk in the underground and other 10 minutes from the exit to the hotel. But if you are not concerned about money, in HK taxis are so cheap... Apart from this the hotel itself is lovely. We booked a double superior room for 2 nights, and we were at the 11th floor. The bed was nice and confortable and there was a couch as well. The bathroom was a see-through one, but with blinds, the shower was hot and powerful. The only problem with hotels in Hong Kong in this season is that they don't have central heathing and at night it did get a bit chilly. So we requested a heather and extra blanket and they were brough to our room immediatly. At the reception there were 2 laptops where you could have free internet access, otherwise there is a connection from the room but it does not come cheap (60HKD per h). The location is lovely, near the busy Time Square district, full of shopping centers and local food market stalls. To be honest I prefer the other part pf HK, Kowloon, but this part is more modern and trendy. The stuff was very nice and helpfull and check - in and check out quick. On the web it was written that check in was from 14.00, however when we arrived at 14.00 the room was not yet ready and they told us we had to wait for 1h. So we just left the luggage and came back in the evening. It is very near to the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for city travellers”
Reviews.Author: MUCTraveller
Reviews.Content: I spend about 100 nights a year in hotels and I have the highest membership category in Hyatt, Starwoods and Shangri La. I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during a city trip to Hong Kong and paid about 75€/night single. Rooms are small, but functional and very clean. Beds are very good. Location of the hotel is central, close to Causeway Bay subway, around the corner from Times Square (ca. 5 min walk). Easy to reach by day and night, Taxi drivers find it easily. Ideal for the city traveller with a certain standard, who is looking for a central location and a 4 star property with excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Slight disadvantages but altogether a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: Nitsan_D
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at The Butterfly and can recommend it... The hotel itself is a bit strangely architectured - it is thin (4 rooms in each floor) and tall (about 30 floors). The outer 2 rooms in each floor are somewhat triangular, with two sides made of large glass windows that allow a very nice view of Hong Kong. The whole thing seems very modern or refurbished. There was no bath - only a nice shower, and the facilities are in a glass room behind the bed (with curtains that shut a bit less than 100%). The bed (mattress) was a little hard. We liked it that way but some may find it too hard. The hotel is located where Wan Chai turns into Causeway Bay. The outside street (Morrison) could be more "shiny" but the Times Square shopping centre in Causeway Bay and the nice area around it (especially in the evenings) is very close. Service was fine and courteous. They insisted bringing up our luggage themselves. However when we asked for one extra day for luggage storage (due to a trip to Macau), it was not possible.

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly experience”
Reviews.Author: shopl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in Butterfly on Morrison. 2 adults and 2 children stayed in the deluxe room. On the 1st night, we arrived late after Disneyland fireworks. We took a train ride and then a taxi from HK Station to Butterfly on Morrison. As we arrived late at night, the taxi was able to alight us outside the hotel. There was police road block and the taxi need to divert. The taxi fare costs HKD72.50 (with 4 luggages in the boot). The room was small, though the toilet is quite spacious. The bathroom door was frosted in the centre only and the four side trimmings were not. To overcome this, we pasted newspapers in the middle. This took us a while to figure out the best way to paste so that we can open and close one door without destroying the newspapers. Next, we had to dealt with an unfriendly housekeeper on the 1st and 2nd nights and managed to convince him that we need four bath towels everyday. He jumped to conclusion too fast and thought we were trying to make a fuss without really listening to our needs first. We were given free broadband during booking. But the receptionist did not explained to us that we had to log as paid broadband and they will waive the internet charges upon check out. The receptionist should have explained to us during check in, instead of waiting for us to enquire. Overall, it was still a good experience as we felt safe staying in the area. Probably due to the bus stop beside the hotel, no matter how late, they will be people waiting along the area. It was a short walk to MTR. We used the tram most of the time while commuting in HK island as it was very cheap and convenient. The room rate was value for money. Not many hotel allowed 4 pax in a room. Most wanted us to book two rooms. On the last day, we drag our luggages outside South Pacific Hotel and managed to catch a taxi very fast The ride is cheaper at $50 (with 4 luggages in the boot). Wasnt too difficult. The South Pacific Hotel was quite near. I will definitely consider to stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: livastar
Reviews.Content: we have stayed there for two nights 2 rooms with our girls age 11 and 17 dec 4th-6th. the staff spoke excellent english and were very helpful in giving us advice about everything. the rooms were nicely decorated and we were staying at 26th floor. the hill view were excellent and you could see some fireworks in the room because of the opening ceremony of the east asia game. easy to get good food and excellent shopping. great value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Value-for-money and well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asperger_Singapore
Reviews.Content: 1. Location: Amidst shopping and food area (Causeway Bay), near huge mall: Times Square, well-linked to other parts of HK by tram and buses, near the entrance to a subway station (Causeway Bay): deceptive though . . . the trains are a very long underground walk away. 2. Hotel is well-maintained, clean and newish. 3. Rooms are ok sized (by HK standards), aircon, hot water, tv (with ok number of channels). Comfortable beds. 4. All staff speaks English very well. Functionally helpful. 5. Free wifi with terminals at lobby but only 1 - 2 terminals at any one time. 6. No restaurants, so no breakfast . . . but not a problem cos of many eateries around. 7. Toiletries could be replaced (by placing new set behind almost used ones) instead of waiting for them to be fully empty. 8. I stayed in 2 different rooms cos I went somewhere else in between. First room has no problem with noise; second room was nearer the major road hotel is along and noise can be a bother from very early on in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for that disgruntled cleaner”
Reviews.Author: pinkpetter
Reviews.Content: I checked out this hotel and the others which are also from the Butterfly chain on Tripadvisor and decided on this on after a few days of research. Since my partner had business to do on Hong Kong Island we picked this one instead of the one on Prat. I loved the aesthetics of the hotel. It looked great from the outside and the inside. The furnishings were of good quality, mainly European brands. We had a Deluxe Room which was very spacious and even had a matching couch. There were little thoughtful touches to the room, like having the bar fridge door attached to the cabinet door so that you can open both at one go. Two odd things caught my eye which I did feedback to the staff. First would be the lack of toothbrush and toothpaste, which I forgot to bring on this trip. The second would be that there wasn't any place to hang our clothes and towels within reach of the shower stall. It was rather chilly to get out of the stall to get clothing after a bath. But these didn't mar my impression of the hotel. The staff were great. On the second day, there was a slight problem with the flushing system in our room and I informed the guest services. The lady (who spoke relatively fluent English like the rest of the reception staff) apologised and explained that they were doing some wetworks but she would see to it that it's fixed before I came back from shopping. I also approached the staff about the internet. In my booking, I was informed that I would be given free broadband in the room but when we entered the room there was some confusion as the system prompted us to pay. I showed the reception my confirmation slip and they immediately apologised for the confusion and asked me to just log on, ignoring the "warning: payment" notice. My only two real gripes: 1) When we entered the room, it was very clean and tidy. No complaints about that. But on the second day, after the housekeeper came in, the place was not as clean as before. I spotted pieces of paper on the carpet and some in the bathroom... things which I don't even recognise. But the rest of the room was relatively clean. 2) The location of the hotel is fine, about 7-10 min walk away from Causeway Bay MTR. Since I'm used to walking and used to taking the train, I was very comfortable with it. However, on the last day, we met with a slight problem. The bus stop and bus lane in front of the hotel prevented people from taking cabs. We had to lug our cases to the junction to grab a cab.

Reviews.Title: “GO FOR IT, EXCELLENT STAFF AND HOTEL, PERFECT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: alexfrombrussels
Reviews.Content: I took a supperior room for two nights, and I it was great, Great staff very friendly and smily, great location and great room brand new and fancy, take a supp room to have a bit space in the room, normal are a bit small for me. If you book with last booking you can have a great price for the supp room. I will defenetely come back there again! Free internet but no BFast which is not quite a problem, so many nice places around the hotel to eat, GREAT CITY Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel for great price”
Reviews.Author: misstokyo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights after spending one at the sister hotel on Prat in TST. I took a taxi from Butterfly on Prat with my suitcase. The front staff were incredibly kind and offered to hold my suitcase until my room was ready. The staff were continually great for my entire stay, always greeting me with a smile, giving assistance with directions and one even remembered my name. I stayed in a superior room, which I think was a corner room as there were two huge floor to ceiling windows on either side of the bed. The view wasn't great but I wasn't really there to sit in my room and look outside. The room size was normal to me and larger than I had imagined after reading some of the reviews. The room was very clean although it wouldn't hurt if the housekeepers vacuumed the corners and edges of the carpeting where it meets the wall once in a while. They left two bottles of water every day after cleaning, which I really appreciated after chilling them in the fridge. I found the room to be quite chilly at night and was not able to adjust the temp from my room (apparently the wall knob is only for AC) but I was told a heater could be brought up if necessary. The bathroom was small but clean except for some hair over the shower drain. The window in the bathroom looks into the room but there was a set of blinds over it. You could not see through the bathroom door although there is a fairly thin strip of glass lining it so I guess you could see inside if you were really trying to check someone out on the toilet. When I needed an iron, someone brought up an ironing board and iron, when I had a relaxing night in, I was able to borrow DVDs from the front desk, and when it rained, the doorman gave me an umbrella. This hotel lacks for nothing when you consider price and location. The Causeway Bay MTR station is a short 10-minute walk away, or you can walk to Hennesey Rd and catch a tram, which I highly recommend. Upon check-out I had to pay for a local call I made so next time I will just my local SIM card. I was also told the nearest airport bus stop was about 10 minutes away, which is 10 minutes too long with a heavy suitcase so I grabbed a cab to Hong Kong Station (about 50 HKD) and checked my bags in there before taking the Airport Express out to the airport. Great hotel, I would stay here again as I can't imagine getting the same level of service and newness anywhere else in HK for the same amount of money (booked on agoda).

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS ARE small.”
Reviews.Author: gleb90210
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms (we were in Standard one). It is bearly enough space for one person. Two people will not even be able to find space to stand together in the room: one should sit on the bed :). 2 or 3 sq m is what you get besides the bed... Transparent bathroom door is pazzling me as well. I do not like myself being seen thru during you-know-what. Apart of it: nice decor, nice staff, close to MTR.

Reviews.Title: “fresh brand new place”
Reviews.Author: lekshu
Reviews.Content: Very nice place just opened when I stayed there. modern furbishings. Close to the underground station. Few minutes walk to the race course. Very comfortable rooms and friendlly stuff. Had a bit of a problem with the internet conection, but apart from that I had a great stay at the Butterfly. Well there was two more things one was the room safes they were not bolted down, so you could pick it up and walk out with it. And the other was the see through glass walls in the bathroom. Might be a bit of a problem when you are sharing with someone and stepping out of the shower with your privates danggling about. Overall the place was tip top. Would recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Great Value Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: one3mac
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Hong Kong to celebrate my birthday in Asia's Mega City. A few days before our trip, we were able to reserve our rooms through Asiatravel.com availing Butterfly on Morrison's 2 paid nights +1 free night promo for the Deluxe Suite. Choosing the hotel was based on 2 factors which were important to us, (1) That the hotel should be situated near the MTR station, and (2) that it within the Island of HongKong preferably in between Causeway Bay and Wanchai where most of the good shops and sights are found. Our criteria were met by Butterfly on Morrison. The location of the hotel is unbeatable. Just 2 blocks up from the Times Square MTR station, gives you plenty of night life and shopping options. Also located right next door is the Happy Valley Racecourse - an extremely green plot of land in the urban jungle that is Hong Kong. You can walk to everywhere, yet it's oddly serene and peaceful for being such a short bit away from party central. If you want to be close to the action, and have a clean, quiet room with service with a genuine friendly attitude, this is for you! If you want a great view from your floor to ceiling window, this one is definitely for you too! No, they dont have a bar or restaurant, but you wont go hungry or thirsty at any time. With the Wanchai market and numerous restaurants just a block away. We arrived at the hotel shortly after 11am. The hotel staff was kind enough to have us leave our luggage in their offices until we were ready to come back to check in after 2pm. The hotel is flat out gorgeous. Meticulous, spotless, tasteful and decadent. You are in for a treat just staying in Hong Kong Island to begin with and not touristy Kowloon or Rowdy Mongkok, but this one is extra special. The minimalist décor and modern furniture is just amazing. After you the front door,on the left of the hallway are 2 elevators, This hotel does not have a ground level lobby, the front desk is situated on the 3rd floor. Upon checking-in, we were given rooms on the 12th floor. Opening the door, you are greeted to a splendid room, Nice high ceilings and elegant moldings everywhere. The view of the Happy Valley from the floor to ceiling windows was just breathtaking. The bed is sitting up against a floor to ceiling panel wall with curving windows on both sides with a working desk. Attached to the wall is a flat screen TV and lamp. On the side of the bathroom is an enormous closet built into the wall. This was spacious, with built in safe and fridge. On the same side as the door to our room, is a glass paneled door leading to the bathroom. Nicely tiled in off-white, this was a very spacious area. Shower (no tub), sink and toilet. Plenty of room for all our bathroom accessories. Exquisitely decorated. The bed was fantastically comfortable and we had no trouble sleeping. The english speaking staff we encountered during our stay were all fabulous and friendly and was always smiling and happy to see us come down each morning on our way out for the day. Free wifi on the 3rd floor as well as free internet in the room through data sockets (but do bring your own plugs), so we stayed connected with our employees back home each morning. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Would have enjoyed the stay more if we were really accommodated in a Deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: sant0224
Reviews.Content: We decided to book a three-night stay in this hotel because it is spanking new and Asiatravel.com was doing a three-night-for-the-price-of-two promotion. We booked a Deluxe room, which, as we had gathered from the hotel website photos and from previous reviews, should be big enough for a couch. Yes, the room we had, on the 8th floor, had the facilities advertised. However, it was far too small to be a Deluxe room, as there was virtually no room for a couch. We are skeptical about its category also because of the lack of a glass partition between the bathroom and the room proper, not to mention the floor level it was located. This is such a shame as the hotel is full of potential, thanks to its design and location. We must say the experience was tarnished by the room-size. Hopefully, it was just a mistake made by the hotel and we will be given the right category of room in our second stay upon return from Macau.

Reviews.Title: “Modern styling, brand-new, great location in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromcali
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this boutique hotel on the buy two nights receive one night free deal on Asiatravel. We received a Superior room that came with free internet access in the room. The room itself looks pretty much exactly like the photos: comfy bed, small couch, desk, chair, flat screen TV. Everything has a clean and modern feel. The Superior room we were in had floor to ceiling windows on two walls - lovely! A lot has been said about the glass bathroom walls in this hotel and the Butterfly on Prat hotel. Indeed, there are glass bathroom walls as well as shower doors and for the room we were in (1901), the room was situated so there was no way to hide behind a door or anything. Hopefully the hotel can put up some frosting on the glass. The staff was excellent and spoke English well. Laundry services at the hotel are really expensive, but there is a laundromat about one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beataO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of September and like other travellers, i took a gamble as there were no reveiws online because hotel had just opened. The rooms were modern and very comfortable, front desk staff were very helpful, and the location was a 8min walk to Causeway Bay MTR. My only concern for travellers is the transperant glass dividers between the bathroom/toilet and main room, if you are travelling with friends this might be an issue - there is no privacy! The hotel might like to consider frosting the glass for some privacy in the toilet/bathroom. I would definately stay here again and recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolFans
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel at last minute, from Asiatravel.com for our family trip to Macau and Hong Kong. Rather pessimistic at first since there was no review at all about this hotel due to its recency, however looking at their sister hotel, the Butterfly on Prat's review, which were generally very good, we decided to take the risk. The price itself was very affordable considering Hong Kong's pricey hotel, and for a 4 stars hotel, the price is indeed not bad at all! The hotel is conveniently located on Morrison Hill Road, with easy access to the tram and buses. It is only about 5 minutes walk to the Time Square shopping center with its Causeway Bay MTR station underneath. There are also a lot of local restaurants to go and also there is a market nearby which sells fresh food and fruits. We went crazy buying cheap fruits every night there! The room itself is small,typical of Hong Kong hotel, yet very beautifully decorated, with minimalistic approach, yet colorful which created a cheerful ambience. The bed was very nice, especially compared to our rock hard bed in our Macau hotel. Each room has a 32' LCD TV, a large fridge and the famous see through toilet/shower. The staff is also very polite and helpful with very good English, so you wouldn't have any problem asking for their assistance. The hotel also has two laptops on the reception that is free to use, with free internet (I guess) in the room. However since I didn't bring my own laptop I could not share this experience. The only downside to it was that taxi was not allowed to stop in front of the hotel, so we had to walk about 20 meters to in front of the South Pacific hotel to catch a cab. Quite annoying if you have a lot of luggage like we did :-) All in all, it is a very satisfying stay and will definitely go back there when I'm in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “very nice, clean and very affordable hotel in city center of hk”
Reviews.Author: babyqc
Reviews.Content: hi everyone like to share my review for butterfly on morrison hk. ..my husband and i booked this hotel oct.15-18,2009. We are very satisfied with our stay..Very accommodating and nice staff.. we requested for late check out since our airport shuttle will pick us up at 5pm ..they let us extend for an hour....the hotel room key uses sensor to open it.. ours is a twin room 1903 the bathroom door is frosted glass and the room has a nice view of the queen east road. The hotel is almost next door to south pacific hotel.. quite a small entrance for their lobby the actual reception is on the 3rd floor..but these will be offset by the ambience you get from your hotel room since for each floor there are only 4 rooms /floor..there is a big ref in our room (compare to other hotel their ref is bigger ..they supplied each room with 2 bottled water/day! ..the ref is bare so you can buy other drinks and food /fruits you like to put inside the ref..all in all we are very please we have choose this hotel but i might say we are a liitle woorried at first since we can't figure it's exact location.. the staff are very helpful and i have a nice talk with Timothy i'll surely recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary chic at bargain price - but those glass bathroom doors!”
Reviews.Author: cmkrd
Reviews.Content: Decided on a last minute trip to HK so booked this only the day before. Read the reviews regarding butterfly on Prat and seemed like a good chain. This is their second location over on HK island and is recently opened with a soft launch of 60 room but more rooms still to come (no construction evidence that we saw/heard). Booked through Asiatravel that had buy 2 nights get 3rd for free making it a very cost effective option. Room is beautiful, contemporary, comfortable (we had a deluxe). Only gripe was with three of us traveling we had taken the option of 1 room for 3 adults but the room was not really big enough. However, it was manageable, harder to manage were the transparent doors to the bathroom. Not the most discrete! Location wise, it doesn't herald any great views and you're not in the thick of it but for the price it is a great option for HK. It has views of Happyvalley racecourse (close enough to see the horses legging it round the track) and a short walk gets you to either the MTR or the tramlines so very straightforward to get anywhere. Great wet market just round the corner too (not to mention the even better street seafood restaurant that makes the most of the produce!). I would definitely recommend this to others, especially couples, friends only if you can handle a slight lack of privacy in the bathroom!

HotelInfo.Name: Butterfly On Morrison
HotelInfo.Address: No.39 Morrison Hill Road, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong, China
